162016.name: Moonbent Path
162016.description:
The game involved players traveling from the centre outwards on a circular board to escape the mysterious "Laken" while trying to get to a mysterious crystal to stop it.
The players moved pieces shaped like strange creatures to escape the Laken. Cards and dice were involved.

162017.name: Starship: Panic
162017.description:
Starship: Panic is a Print & Play 1-7 player, co-operative game about a team of Space Explorers attempting to survive disaster. To survive, the team must work together and keep the pile of metal and bolts known as their Starship intact. The players will have to deal with internal and external threats by activating various stations aboard the ship.

The game features a tile-based ship and multiple player characters creating a large amount of variation.

The players win by completing a set number of Red Level Events which can change depending on the desired challenge and length.

Starship: Panic takes place over a series of rounds. Each round consists of each player taking a turn.
A player's turn involves: taking actions, activating event cards, and drawing new event cards.

Each player is permitted 2 actions: Move, Station Action, Combat, Repair, or Trade. Then any event cards the player possesses, is activated. Finally, a new event card is drawn.

The Starship: Panic PnP files includes 2 pages of rules and 17 pages of printable pieces included tiles, cards, tokens and player sheets.

Additional Components needed: 6 blank white dice (16mm), 7 blank black dice (16mm), 1 d8, 2 x 1cm wooden cubes

Optional Components: A lot of red cubes to mark damage, At least 12 black cubes to represent Invaders, 7 Player Pawns- one in each color.

162019.name: Racing Comrade!
162019.description:
User Summary

Racing Comrade! is a game in which you play as a soviet runner attempting to win races for the glory of the motherland. Performing well in a race grants a cash prize which can be spent on upgrading your runner's equipment and skills. The game allows for underhand tactics to be used but beware the party officials who frown on such behaviour.

The running is carried out automatically by the game; you attempt to influence the race and your runner's performance by activating the 'sprint' powerups and using other actions when appropriate. Your stamina decreases when actions are used but can be replenished by clicking on items strewn along the course or via the 'breathe deeply' action.

162021.name: The Arena of Khaboom
162021.description:
publisher blurb

A Tunnels & Trolls solo adventure for warriors, wizards and rogues of all levels. 72 foes, new spells - this is a bestiary and combat manual as well as solo with endless replay value.

Fight as a champion on a full contract or as a challenger for just a handful of death matches; risk your life for rewards of money and magic.

The Arena of Khazan is legendary and on the Kraken continent the Arena of Khaboom is second only to Pentagram Square itself. You may be ready to face the roar of the crowd against a goblin but can you keep their support until you are ready to face a dragon?

Richly illustrated by Stanley Ditko.

162022.name: 6 nimmt! Schnupperspiel
boardgameversion: AMIGO Spiel + Freizeit GmbH German edition
162022.description:
6 nimmt! Schnupperspiel is a small, promotional copy of 6 nimmt! containing 24 cards and playable for 2 to 4 players.

The game plays very similar to 6 nimmt! except that the cards here are numbered 1 through 24. With 2 players, each player will be dealt a hand of 10 cards, but for 3 or 4 players, each player starts with 7 or 5 cards, respectively. 3 of the remaining cards form the rows where players will play their cards. Players simultaneously select a card to play and will add their cards to the rows in ascending order. If a player selects a card that is so low it cannot be added to any series, that player takes a row of cards and the low card begins a new row. Each row can contain at most 5 cards. The player that places the 6th card must take the other cards in the row and the 6th card is used to start a new row.

The object of the game is to have the lowest score at the end of 4 rounds. Rounds end after all cards have been played. Players score points for each ox head present on the cards they collect.

162023.name: Riimukiwi (issue #5 - 1990)
rpgissuearticle: Kahden Kamppailu: Mies miestä vastaan - Phoenix Command vs. Sniper
162023.description:
No special theme but Suomen Roolipeliyhdistys and the Riimukiwi newsletter are stuggling to prove the need for their existence with many new RPG communities or societies etc. being formed around Finland and three commercial RPG magazines being published alongside Riimukiwi.

ISSN 0786-7913

162024.name: Sangin Despatches No.1
162024.description: This supplement includes additional scenarios and rules for the Skirmish Sangin miniatures game. The book includes four new orders of battle for Canadians, Germans, Afghan National Police, and the 611 Militia. There are seven new scenarios, campaign & character experience rules, a game play primer, and tactics articles from ex-military personnel.

162025.name: Bird of a Feather
162025.description:
From the front cover:

With the joyous blaring of blaterpfeifes, sacbuts and crumhorns still ringing in their ears, a group of men have left the annual village totentanz to replenish the dwindling supply of meat. This was their chance to be the toast of the tantz. Lightly armed but well-stocked, an easier path to immortality was never proffered.

Driven by pain from an angry nest, another hunter sets forth; instinct and angst would be the hunter's bane.

From the back cover:

GREAT THINGS DO COME IN SMALL PACKAGES!

From the team that brought you Whisper & Venom comes the first in a line of session-ready adventures called THOPAS SHORTS. Bird of a Feather is a convenient drop-in scenario for fantasy campaigns.

THOPAS SHORTS are well-designed, professionally produced adventures for games inspired by vintage-style rules, with an emphasis on quality writing. Lesser Gnome is committed to making every THOPAS SHORT easy to integrate into your campaign without distracting your vision.

THOPAS SHORTS: YOUR CAMPAIGN, YOUR RULES...OUR PLEASURE!

User summary:

The first printing came supplied with a metal bird figure for use with the adventure.

162026.name: The Peril of Ardun: Incursion Into Newiron
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
162026.description:
From the back cover:

The Turan tribes on the high steeps of eastern Tibbenian have banded together and are on the offensive! They call themselves The Order of the Red Blade, and are moving east, recruiting or enslaving humanoid and human tribes as they go. The Order has entered the territory of Fallmeade, and threatens to occupy its capital, Clydwyn.

You find yourself in the mining town of Craldash, in central Ardun, a country to the south of Fallmeade, just beyond the Oktan Mountains. You are approached by a representative of the local governor who says her employer is looking for a stout party of adventurers to help him with a little problem.

Her contacts have reported some unusual activity near an old abandoned temple to the west. A garrison of Red Blade soldiers has entered the temple grounds and set up shop. The governor would like the garrison removed or at least run off, along with any other information you can find. Are you up to the task?

From the front cover:

A fantasy adventure compatible with first edition gaming and OSRIC. Recommended for 4-6 characters of level 2-4.

162027.name: Kramforsspelet
162027.description: This is a promotional game from a line of similar ones, each named and themed for a Swedish town, and self-described as a cross between Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit. Players roll and move around the board. At specific points they have the opportunity to acquire properties that allow them to collect rent from other players, or to collect dividends on owned properties; answering trivia questions may be necessary to take these actions or increase their effectiveness. There are also event cards that may require players to answer questions to determine what happens, event spaces that require players to play a game of chance for property ownership, and more. The game may be played until one player goes bankrupt, until all players but one go bankrupt, or for a predetermined amount of time.

boardgamepublisher: Departament de Cultura. Generalitat de Catalunya
162028.description:
300 fets de llengua ("300 language events") is a word/linguistics game on the history of Catalan language. It consists in 300 round cards, each one containing a brief note on a historical event related to the Catalan language and a challenge for the players. There are 10 different kinds of challenges: to create anagrams, to find words, to define words, to identify acronyms, to guess word meanings, etc.

In a game, 30 cards are selected at random: these will be the challenges to the players; and each player begins with 300 points. The game is played in turns. In a player's turn, he/she draws one of the 30 cards and reads the brief historical note and the kind of challenge. Then all players bet points to solve the challenge, before actually knowing the challenge (they just know its kind). After deducting the points bet of each player, the active player reads the challenge and the players try to solve it. All players having solved the challenge receive double the points they bet, while the higher better receives three times the points bet; the players not having solved the challenge receive nothing. After the 30 challenges have been played, the player with most points is the winner.
162028.name: 300 fets de llengua

162029.name: Ars Gladiatoria
162029.description:
publisher blurb
A game inspired by the TV series Spartacus blood and sands. True fans will be able to breathe the air of the arena, feel the bitter taste of the sand and see the blood flow in streams in a mortal struggle from which only one will come out the winner, winning the freedom ...

user summary

Ars Gladiatoria is a competitive role-playing game in which you must fight and suffer in an attempt to stand out with your gladiator, crushing the other players' characters in the race to the glory of the arena.

IN THIS GAME YOU WILL FIND:

A game of strategy and storytelling for 3-6 players.

Rules for creating your gladiator and all the characters that will affect his or her life, and that will lead to freedom or death.

A tactical combat system to recreate the tension of the fighting arena with spectacular moves and fights to the death.

Rules for 8 modalities of games, different and characterized to vary your games.

The gods of the arena, an extra game mode for fast and furious clashes.

162030.name: Woodle Tree Adventures
162030.description:
An old school plat­form game with a catchy and unique art style! You will find all the clas­si­cal ele­ments from the 90’s games and new inter­est­ing ideas.

Explore a total of 6 worlds and save the lands bring­ing back peace and bal­ance and finally becom­ing the new hero.

Source: The Developer Website.

162031.name: Memm
162031.description:
RULES
2-4 Players. Age +6 years

DESCRIPTION
At first sight, memm appears to be a simple game as it is composed by only 36 geometric cubes of different colours. However, memm goes far beyond this apparent simplicity. memm is a dynamic, visually entertaining and aesthetically attractive game, but above all, memm is game full of possibilities and lots of game play. These characteristics makes memm the ideal cognitive development game to play with the whole family.

PREPARATION
The 36 coloured cubes are placed on the table, mixed and shared equally amongst the participants. Then a cube with all the six colours is rolled. The player having the cube with the resulting colour on all its 6 sides will start the game by placing this cube in the centre of the table.

GAMEPLAY
Clockwise, the following players will place one cube so that joining sides match colours. A cube can be placed on top of the starting cube. However, this move will be subject to a special rule that will be discussed in the SPECIAL RULE section.

ABILITY TO REPEAT TURN
A player gains the ability to repeat turn if he joins a cube by two sides. Please note this is only physically possible as from the fourth turn.
A player gains the ability to repeat turn and get rid of one of his cubes by handing it to a player of his choice if he joins a cube by three sides.
A player gains the ability to repeat turn and get rid of two of his cubes by handing them to a player of his choice if he joins a cube by four sides.

If a player joins a cube by five sides, gains the ability to repeat turn and get rid of three of his cubes by handing them to a player of his choice.

SPECIAL RULE
No more than three cubes will be placed in the same direction in a row of turns. This rule prevents the formation of continuous lines of cubes and is not to be confused with a limitation of the central structure being developed during the game. When a player places a cube on top of another, the player will have, on his next turn, the possibility of you can also put it in one of the free sides of any of the cubes that are in the same vertical.

OBJECTIVE
The first player who gets rid of all his cubes wins the game. However, unless this player is the last to play in the round, the remaining players will be placing their cubes until the full round of turns is completed. At that point, the player left with more cubes loses. In a tie in number of cubes , you will lose more different colours have. If they have the same number of colours , the result will be a tie.

VARIATIONS OF THE GAME
This is the basic and general form of the game. Nevertheless, a number of variants were also explored to create a series of dimensional figures that would condition the placement of cubes. Some examples are detailed in the photo section.
A rotating circular table can be added to the game to facilitate players with the different angles and spatial perspective of the figure being created and gain fluency and aesthetics in the game.
Specification (Components, forms, materials, sizes):
Components : game box , instructions , manual with different figures to make and 36 cubes with the following distribution of coloured sides :
6 cubes with all sides the same colour.
6 cubes with 5 sides of the same colour and with a different side.
6 cubes with 4 sides of the same colour and with 2 different sides.
6 cubes with 3 sides of the same colour and with 3 different sides.
6 cubes with 2 sides of the same colour and with 4 different sides.
6 cubes with all sides of different colour.

In principle, the chosen colours are red , yellow , orange , violet, blue and green.

Each cube will have on each side a roman number that determines the number of sides with that colour. For example, a "V" on the a red face of a cube means that there are 5 red sides on that cube.



1 Descripción de memm: Jugadores: de 2 a 4. Edad: +6 años.
memm aparenta ser un juego sencillo por tratarse sólo de 36 cubos geométricos de diferentes colores, pero va más allá de esa aparente sencillez. memm es un juego con multitud de posibilidades, dinámico, muy estético (al quedar figuras de colores increíbles), entretenido y, sobre todo, con muchísima jugabilidad.

2 Instrucciones
Se colocan los 36 cubos de colores en la mesa, se remueven y se reparten equitativamente entre los jugadores participantes. Se lanza un cubo con un color diferente en cada cara y empieza el que tenga el cubo con las 6 caras del color que haya salido. Se comienza la partida situando el cubo en el centro de la mesa. El siguiente jugador (los turnos se realizan en orden del sentido de las agujas del reloj) tendrá que colocar una de las caras de los cubos que le ha tocado en una de las caras libres del último cubo puesto en la mesa. Esta unión de caras sólo se podrá realizar si coinciden en su color. Los jugadores podrán situar el cubo en la cara superior, pero esta acción estará sujeta a una regla especial de la sección 3. Se procederá de la misma manera en turnos siguientes con las siguientes condiciones:
3 Posibilidad de repetición de turno

Cubo toca una sola cara con último cubo puesto: no coloca ningún cubo más y pasa a siguiente jugador según turno.

Cubo en la mesa toca dos caras con último cubo puesto: posibilidad de colocar otro cubo de nuevo.

Cubo en la mesa toca tres caras con último cubo puesto: posibilidad de colocar otro cubo de nuevo y puede deshacerse de un cubo suyo, entregándoselo al jugador que crea conveniente.

Cubo en la mesa toca cuatro caras con último cubo puesto: posibilidad de colocar otro cubo de nuevo y puede deshacerse de dos cubos suyos, entregándoselos al jugador o jugadores que crea conveniente.

Cubo en la mesa toca cinco caras con último cubo puesto: posibilidad de colocar otro cubo de nuevo y puede deshacerse de tres cubos suyos, entregándoselos al jugador o jugadores que crea conveniente.

4 Reglas especiales
No se podrá colocar más de tres cubos en turnos seguidos en la misma dirección. Esta regla evita la formación de una línea interminable de cubos y no debe ser confundida con una limitación de las dimensiones de la estructura a formar durante el juego.

Cuando un jugador coloca un cubo sobre otro cubo en cualquier nivel de la estructura, el mismo jugador (en caso de unión de 2 o más caras) o el siguiente jugador (en caso de unión de una sola cara) deberá colocar su cubo de tal manera que haga contacto con la vertical sobre la que descansa ese cubo, incluyendo éste.

5 Objetivo final
Un jugador ganará la partida cuando sea el primero en deshacerse de todos sus cubos, aunque deberá esperar a que el último jugador de esa ronda haya completado su turno. Es decir, el resto de jugadores podrán colocar sus cubos e incluso entregar sus cubos a cualquier contrincante hasta la finalización esa ronda.. En ese momento, perderá el que se haya quedado con más cubos. Si hay empate en número de cubos, perderá el que más colores diferentes posea. Si tienen el mismo número de colores, habrá empate en dicho jugadores.

Esta es la modalidad básica y general del juego. Pero se pensó en las miles de posibilidades de unas piezas tan versátiles. Por lo que se empezó a crear una serie de figuras ficticias para delimitar la colocación de los cubos. Se detallará algún ejemplo en la sección de fotos. También se puede incorporar al juego una
tabla circular giratoria para así facilitar la visión espacial de la figura desde cualquier perspectiva y de paso agilizar el juego.

Memoria descriptiva (Componentes, formas, materiales, medidas):

6 Componentes
Caja de juego, instrucciones, manual con las diferentes figuras a realizar y 36 cubos con la siguiente distribución de caras de colores:

6 cubos con todas las caras de un mismo color.
6 cubos con 5 caras de un mismo color y con una cara de color diferente.
6 cubos con 4 caras de un mismo color y con 2 caras de color diferente.
6 cubos con 3 caras de un mismo color y con 3 caras de color diferente.
6 cubos con 2 caras de un mismo color y con 4 caras de color diferente.
6 cubos con todas sus caras de color diferente.
En principio, los colores elegidos son el rojo, amarillo, naranja, violeta, azul y verde.

Cada cubo tendrá en cada cara un número en romano que determina el número de caras que tiene ese color en el cubo. Por ejemplo, si en una cara roja de un cubo se encuentra una “V”, significará que en ese cubo hay 5 caras rojas.

162034.name: Animal/Vegetable/Mineral
162034.description:
From the booklet:

Animal/Vegetable/Mineral

The child is requested to think of an object that is either animal, vegetable or mineral. The program will now try to guess what the child has thought of. It asks questions about the object and then guesses what the object is.

If the program does not know the object then the child can 'teach the computer' about the object. The child also needs to give the program information to tell the object apart from the other things it knows.

At the start the program knows only a little, so it is easy to teach the computer things. The more it knows the more the need to look things up! The information stored can be saved and reloaded at any point in order to continue to build up what the computer knows at a later date.

162035.description:
The storyline of The Pre-Sequel will focus on Handsome Jack and his attempt to escape his exile from the Hyperion moonbase, and capture it for himself. The main characters of Athena, Wilhelm, Nisha, and Claptrap, will begin the game as henchmen of Handsome Jack. Jack himself will have "morally good intentions" at the beginning of the story, but will slowly transform into the "horrific, evil villain he is in Borderlands 2 that seems to have enjoyed cutting people's eyeballs out with a spoon." Pitchford stated that the game's plot would explore how villains.

Source: Wikipedia, "Borderlands: The_Pre-Sequel!," available under the CC-BY-SA License.
videogamehonor: 2014 Gamescom Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Global Game Awards Best Co-op Game of the Year Nominee
162035.name: Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
videogameexpansion: Claptastic Voyage and Ultimate Vault Hunter Upgrade Pack 2

162036.name: Star Trek (2013)
162036.description:
Star Trek is a third-person action-adventure Star Trek video game.

Gameplay

The game is a single-player action game with cooperative gameplay elements allowing two people to control Kirk and Spock. During his E3 pitch, Steve Sinclair described the game's genre as "bro-op". The game doesn't allow players to switch between Kirk and Spock during a chapter, nor does it allow for fellow players to "drop-in" to play alongside co-operatively.

The two characters show different gameplay techniques, with Kirk being the more typical shooter while Spock has stealth techniques and can use both the Vulcan nerve pinch and mind meld. Each are armed with weapons to reflect their gameplay style, with Kirk armed with a phaser equipped with a stun setting, while Spock's weapon is quieter and freezes enemies instead. As the player progresses through the game, they gain experience allowing them to unlock additional settings on the weapons. The Gorn are set to be the enemies of the game, attacking the New Vulcan colony.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Trek (2013 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

162037.name: Hohokum
videogamehonor: 2011 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
2015 British Academy Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2015 D.I.C.E. Sprite Award Nominee
2015 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2015 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Nominee
162037.description:
The player is a serpent creature called the "Long Mover", a reference to British comedy troupe The Mighty Boosh. There are few set objectives, though the game is non-linear. There is no score, time limit, or tutorial. Developer Richard Hogg has said that the game is about "relaxing in a space and just enjoying the experience and the music, instead of trying to complete it to make progress".

Source: Wikipedia, "Hohokum," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

162038.description:
There's a serial killer on the loose, and you're a Private Eye trying to track him down. You and other Private Eyes will take turns questioning witnesses to get clues from them. You can try and feed the witness some information in hopes of jogging their memory, but you risk pushing them too hard.

If you aren't careful, the witness will crack and feed you false information, which sets back your investigation. The first detective to collect 15 clues catches the serial killer and solves the case.

The first player will reveal a witness card and roll a D10. Add the value of the D10 with the number on the witness card to get the witness value. This represents the stress the witness will be able to endure before cracking. Each player's goal is to get as close to the witness value without going over.

Each player in turn order chooses to roll 1-5 of their D6. If their roll turns out lower than desired, the player may pay a clue to roll an additional die to add to the value. If a player exceeds the witness value, the witness cracks under pressure and gives bad information, causing the offending player to lose two clues. After all players have rolled, the player who is closest to the witness value without cracking the witness gains clues equal to the number of dice they rolled.

The game ends once any player gets 15 or more clues at the end of a round.
162038.name: Private Die
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episide 17: Bonsai!

162039.name: Zoophoria
162039.description:
A game of Zoophoria takes place over seven rounds, representing one week. Players start with four animals, three employees and two secret targets. Each day, a new selection of animals, employees, buildings, food supplies, targets and more will be available. Players will draft three items from the 19 available as new additions to their habitat. Strategy and planning must be used to create a habitat that can manage the daily food, virus and trash production. If the growing collection of animals is fed and remain healthy, and the habitat is kept clean, visitors will come to enjoy the zoo.

Over 90 unique animals from around the world available to build your habitat. Earn extra visitors by creating themed exhibits containing mammals, reptiles, birds, endangered species and more.

Over 50 unique employees and buildings are available to provide assistance. Upgrade or add a new Keeper to produce more food. Install trash cans and recycling bins to keep the zoo clean. Enlist Veterinarians to ensure animals don’t get sick. Add restaurants, photo spots, souvenir stands or other guest services to attract even more visitors.

The player who attracts the most visitors to the zoo will win the challenge and earn the title, Director of Zoophoria.

162040.name: Senran Kagura 2: Deep Crimson
videogamehonor: 2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Nintendo Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Gal of the Year Winner
162040.description:
User Summary

Senran Kagura 2: Deep Crimson is the direct sequel to Senran Kagura Burst and follows a similar premise.

162041.description:
Ninja Taisen is a two-player, dice-driven open information abstract game with a random set-up. Both players have identical sets of ten fighters, with three fighters in each of three colors with values 1–3 along with a tri-colored boss valued at 4; these fighters are placed in small stacks of varying size onto a line that's eleven steps long. On a player's turn, he rolls the three colored dice and can make up to three moves accordingly, with the blue die moving a blue fighter, etc. Moving a fighter that has other fighters on top of him moves these other fighters as well.

If, as a result of movement, his fighter (or stack of fighters) encounters an enemy, a fight between the two top cards in each stack occurs, the result of which is decided primarily by the color (via a rock-paper-scissors mechanism) and secondarily by the number (highest wins). If the boss wins a fight, its power is reduced by the enemy's power for the remainder of the current fight; if two fighters draw, they both retreat one step toward their own village, possibly precipitating other fights on the same turn. The fight continues until either pile is depleted.

The first player to either defeat all of the opposing fighters or reach the end of the line (and clear out the opponent's fighters in his village) wins.
162041.name: Ninja Taisen

162042.name: Zombicide Box of Zombies Set #8: Murder of Crowz
162042.description:
It was inevitable that crows would get infected, scavenging all those zombie bodies. It was also inevitable that it would be very bad news. Crowz may be easy to kill, but these flying vermin can move awfully fast and, worst of all, they can ignore any obstacles, either flying over them or squeezing through broken windows, holes in the roof or gaps on crumbling walls!

This box of Zombies implements infected Crows into the Zombicide games. The box contains 15 miniatures and the spawn cards to play them.

Note: This item, although functioning in a similar way to Zombicide: Black Plague – Murder of Crowz, does not expand Zombicide: Black Plague, and Zombicide: Black Plague – Murder of Crowz does not expand Zombicide, because of the card backs. This entry allows for the correct items to be linked as expansions to the correct entries.

162043.description:
Game covers two battle of the american civil war. First one, fought on July 21, 1861 was also first major battle of this war as well. Second, fought August 28–30, 1862, was the culmination of an offensive campaign waged by Confederate Gen. Robert E. Lee's Army of Northern Virginia against Union Maj. Gen. John Pope's Army of Virginia.

Game was published in the 35 issue of the "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine. It uses "Napoleon" game system.
162043.name: Bull Run 1861/1862

162044.name: DEUS
162044.description:
Press Release

TAKE A NEW WORLD BY STORM AS A BOUNTY HUNTER

Toronto, Ontario, Canada, October 1, 1996 -- Escape from the day-to-day rat race of the here and now and enter the futuristic world of the 22nd century as DEUS, a determined and aggressive bounty hunter on the planet Alcibiade. In this new action-filled and incredible realistic role-playing adventure game, your mission is to track and kill the terrorists who have captured your planet's research station.

However, the way to these skilled and dangerous radicals is anything but easy. You will face a myriad of challenges including jungles, swamps and traps. In oder to survive, you'll have to avoid these pitfalls and solve mind-bending puzzles. From every side, you will be attacked by a variety of predators, such as blobs, cannibals, baby Yetis, and Samurai robots. In a flash, you can go from being the hunter to being the hunted, with a bounty placed on your own head. With the terrorists taken care of, your mission isn't finished. You must still save the station and collect your reward.

Players can choose between two game modes: role playing or arcade. The first will appeal to those who prefer strategy, while the second caters to those who crave action. Two modes means twice the fun and double the entertainment. It's like getting two different games in a single box.

In role-playing mode, you will experience the real-life physical challenges (including pounding heart rate, injuries, fatigue and poisoning) of your character, created by the game's real-time simulation. Your job is to keep track of your food, energy, health and blood pressure to ensure that you don't perish before you reach your goal.

For the most aggressive players, DEUS's arcade mode lets you grab a weapon and mow down any and every enemy in your path. Choose anything from an axe to a rocket launcher from your personal arsenal and attack any of the 40 different enemies that are lying in wait for you. DEUS animates characters and landscapes in 3D and adds 3D stereo sound, multiple light sources, and transparency and wave effects. The result of two years of work by 15 artists, musicians and programmers, this game provides high-quality animation, real-time effects, and unbelievable realism.

DEUS, which is Windows 95 and DOS compatible, requires a minimum configuration of a Pentium 90 processor, SVGA monitor, 8 Mb of RAM, a quad-speed CD-ROM drive and a 16-bit sound card. DEUS costs $69.98 and is available on CD-ROM.

162045.name: Fore Par Table Golf
162045.description:
Bumper Golf is a deluxe version of the carom golf game, you might play at a Parks and Recreation building. The game board depicts an entire 18-hole golf course. Players shoot their 'balls' (wooden disks) from the numbered tee spots and aim for the equivalent numbered 'hole' (cup depression.)

There are two ways to play. In the first version, each player plays each hole one at a time keeping track of his shots. At the end of 18 holes the player with the fewest strokes wins. For a more interactive game, players alternate taking shots, thus allowing chances to block off holes or knock other players balls out of position. In this version the first player to complete the course is the winner.

This original game by World Wide Games would later be republished as Bumper Golf after an acquisition by S&S Worldwide.

162046.name: Flappy Golf
162046.description:
Flap your way to the hole with this unique spin of SSG2! Using the now famous 'flap' mechanic you, must get to the hole in the fewest flaps possible.

Source: The Publisher Website.

162047.name: Wayfinder (Issue 11 - Jul 2014)
rpgissuearticle: End Rhyme: A poetry class with famed half‑orc poet Tal Granite
Golarion Gazetteer: Senara, City of Hellspawn
Heroes Hoard: Tools of the Contract
Heroes’ Hoard: Deck of Devilish Bargains
Heroes’ Hoard: From the Signifers’ Forges
House of Cards: A Tavern Game in “Honor” of the Thrune Ascendency
Infernal Options: Arcane Schools with a Touch of the Devil(S) Inside
A Musical Interlude: Popular Songwriters of Cheliax
Realm Building: Iron Gauntlet, Silk Glove
Schools of Hard Knocks: Gladiator Training in Cheliax
Slipping By: or, The Unofficial Official Abridged Guide to Making the Most of Life as a “Slave”, by Varin Gullbottom
Tales of the Arcane Archaeologists: Through Hell For High Magic
The Bookbound Herald: A Side Trek Adventure
The County of Hell’s Teeth A Gazetteer of the Islands of Hellmouth Bay
The Fury of Hell: Chelish Rage Powers
The Imperial Army of Her Infernal Majestrix
Weal or Woe: The Docks of Khari
162047.description:
From the Paizo Publishing, LLC website:

Created for Pathfinder fans by Pathfinder fans, the eleventh issue of the ENnie Award-winning Wayfinder fanzine revels in the infernal glory that is Cheliax! This free fanzine includes dozens of articles, including original fiction, new monsters, adventures, classes and options, magic items, and even item cards! All this, and much, much more can be yours....

Wayfinder #11 is a 102-page full-color PDF suitable for printing or viewing on your computer. It is released under the Paizo's Community Use Policy.

162049.name: Anduin (Issue 87 - May 2004) Religionen
162049.description:
Feature topic of this particularly long issue (146 pages) is religion. It contains the usual mix of adventures, articles, fiction, and reviews. Among the contents is the second part of a V:tM chronicle (continued from the previous issue), child-friendly adventures for DSA, a regional description for Aventurien, and the third part of a scenario series for Buffy the Vampire Slayer.

There is also an interview with Tommy Heinig about the history of Anduin and about the strength and weaknesses of fanzines.

162051.name: Double Check
162051.description:
Double Check is a game of Checkers adapted for four players in teams of two. It is played on a 14 x 14 square grid with nine squares of each corner removed, resulting in a cross-shaped checkered board. The game is played on the dark squares only, and each wing of the board has twelve dark squares to host twelve pieces in their starting positions. There are pieces of four colors: black, white, red, and green. Each player chooses a partner and their own color, and sets up their pieces in starting positions opposite the board from each other. Play proceeds clockwise around the board.

Players move their pieces and capture other players the same as in Checkers, moving only towards the opposite side of the board until their pieces can be crowned in their partner's home row, and moving in any direction after. Only opponent's pieces may be jumped or captured. Pieces cannot be crowned in opponent's home rows. Movements are not otherwise restricted on any part of the board. The team who eliminates their opponents' pieces, or prevents them from moving, wins the game.

There is one variant provided for in the game's rules, in which players are allowed to jump their partner's pieces without capturing them.

162052.name: Kronstadt 1921
162052.description:
This wargame tells a valorous page of the Russian Revolution: the revolt of the sailors and workers of the fleet base of Kronstadt against the rude attitude and program of the Bolshevik Soviet. Even if the rebellion was put by an end by violence, Lenin adapted some of the requests with the NEP at the X Congress.

ATTENTION: it is a diceless game!

162053.name: La Battaglia di Gravellona Toce 1944
162053.description:
Gravellona 1944 è la simulazione della battaglia di Gravellona Toce, svoltasi tra i partigiani della Repubblica dell'Ossola e i reparti repubblichini nel Settembre 1944.

Una simulazione tattica con diversi spunti interessanti!

Regole in italiano, pedine di gioco e tabelle!!

The game represents the battle between Italian partisans and republican fascists in September 1944. It is a tactical simulation with interesting ideas; units can do Actions by using Action Points, which are gained at the end of each turn and which must be planned carefully by the player.
Combat units are usually at platoon level or single veichle; each unit has a different capacity of fire, depending from the type of fire (Infantry, Tanks or Artillery) and the type of target (Infantry, Tanks and Veichles, Concrete targets). Morale tests and Hit results can apply on Fire, as well as during Melèe.

162054.name: A Catalog of Sentient Races, Volume I: Lizardmen
162054.description:
From publisher blurb:

This brief treatment addresses Lizardmen for the Æther system! It gives a quick summary of culture, appearance, and includes mechanics for creating Lizardman characters.

Part of the character creation process includes determining a random mutation for your individual Lizardman. The information inside is sparse, but if there is enough interest in this project, we will devote more pages and add art to an expanded race book for Lizardmen!

162055.name: Broken Water Main
162055.description:
From the Introduction

The district, home to various small businesses, has always been a quite neighborhood. The narrow streets, one story brick and mortar houses with the large display windows and wide walkways always had a charm of their own. Unbeknownst to the people working or shopping above disaster was brewing below the surface though. Not too long ago a water main, weakened by years of wear and tear finally gave in and burst. The water flooded the streets and to a degree the buildings as well. At least it was a fresh water pipe and not a pipe of the sewer network. The water has been turned off since then, but the broken pipe and the washed out street still need to be fixed.

162056.name: The Queen of the Lost Valley
162056.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to The Queen of the Lost Valley, the sixth adventure of the Beasts & Barbarians Savage Words setting!

The pass through the Iron Mountains has been impassable for months due to the bandits of Justaios the Rebel. But this cannot stop an enterprising merchant like Jannah the Red, who has discovered another long-forgotten pass on an ancient map.

Savage barbarians, breath-taking escapes and a strange lost paradise await you, in the deep secluded valleys of the Iron Mountains where no civilized man has set foot in centuries. Are you ready to face the Queen of the Lost Valley and put your hands on her mythic treasure?

This booklet includes a Book of Lore expansion on the Iron Mountains, their savage people and a host of strange forgotten places...

162057.name: Flooded Town
162057.description:
From the Introduction

Long and hard rain showers combined with melting snow have caused numerous creeks, rivers and even lakes to leave their usual beds. Their water has among other things flooded this town. While some roads and houses are about to disappear into the floods others are lucky enough to be situated on high ground. In some areas only rooftops and the crowns of trees peek out of the water. The building in other houses are untouched as of yet. At least for now they are save. Of course if the water keeps rising only a feet or two separate these as of yet unaffected neighborhoods from disaster.

162058.name: Market Square
162058.description:
From the Introduction

Surrounded by houses of various heights this small market is only one of many in the city. Awnings provide at least some shade in the harsh light of the day, both for the stalls on the market and the small shops surrounding it. Numerous small alleys and a single slightly wider road lead away from the market. For an athletic and nimble individual the rooftops might provide another way to and from the market though. One that only few others will ever take.

162059.name: Altar of the Deep God
162059.description:
From the Introduction

The deep god is not like any other god. It is a primeval force from times before times. For this reason its altar is not just a block of stone. Indeed the altar is consists of the gigantic remnants of an ancient monolith out in the murky water of the rocky reef. Many creatures venerated the old god here and made bloody sacrifices. Very few of them were even remotely human. Although the fishermen of the nearby villages do not really understand the power they toy with they still bring victims to be sacrificed quite regular. They get shipped out here by boat and are herded up the stairs cut out of the stone to be chained to the large standing stone circle. Only a few torches illuminate the scene with their flickering light. And once the alien tentacles begin to rise from the murky depths to snatch the latest offerings anyone foolhardy enough to watch the scene will wish there was no light at all, as nothing seen can be unseen.

162060.name: Playground
162060.description:
From the Introduction

A small playground at the intersection of two paths in a park. Shaded by some trees and separated from the city at large by the rest of the park children can play here while their parents can relax on the benches while still having an eye on their offspring. Jungle gyms, a slide and two sandboxes are hardly a very impressive arsenal, but for children looking to have a fun time it might just be enough.

162061.name: Medieval City Streets
162061.description:
From the Introduction

Row upon row of cheap wooden or half timbered houses dominate this part of town. Most are only two stories tall but some stand taller. Even the main streets are rather narrow and most pathways could not accommodate a cart of any size. As if it were not enough that too many rather flammable houses crowd much too close in this district the same can be said about the numerous people living here. Large crowds, narrow alleys and thin walls make for an explosive mix at the best of times.

162062.description:
In the year 2220, criminal gangs and organizations have moved from the streets and back alleys of the physical world to the fiber optics of cyberspace. The two most infamous hacker crews, the ruthless Black_Skulls and the guileful White_Wolves are on the front lines of this new digital war; devastating security systems and vying for notoriety. When warfare is virtual, reputation is everything.

Overview
In #VECTOR, two players take control of rival hacker crews in a constant struggle to rule the grid. As the leader of a crew, you will increase your reputation and damage your opponent’s in three key ways:
1) Controlling the grid by converting it to your crew’s color
2) Using remote exploits to damage your opponent’s system
3) Hacking into your opponent’s mainframe and stealing valuable data

Objective
There are a limited amount of REP tokens in the general supply. The player with the most REP when the token supply runs out wins!
162062.name: #VECTOR

162063.name: Space Frak
162063.description:
Space Frak is an old-school, touchscreen-mashing space shooter for iPhone and iPad. Blast your way through an endless series of levels, as the insect-like swarms of invaders get tougher and nastier.

Controls
- Tap the screen to fire your gun in that direction.
- Hold your finger down to charge your gun, then release to fire a powerful blast.
- Charging your gun also draws in powerups.

Features
- Fully Game Center compatible
- Online leaderboards and 10 challenging achievements
- Dozens of enemies and bosses
- Dazzling visuals
- Real-time enemy destruction effects
- Stunning space backgrounds inspired by actual NASA Hubble imagery
- 5 Powerups, including Triple Shot, Machine Gun, and Hyper Blast
- Endless level cycles: The difficulty will continue to increase as long as you can handle it

Advanced Tips
- A powerful laser blast can destroy multiple enemies.
- Destroy several enemies with a single shot to earn combos for big points.
- Large combos cause powerups to appear more often.
- In later levels, certain enemies can only be damaged by asteroids.
- Fire at an asteroid to set it ablaze and send it toward incoming spacecraft.

Source: The Developer Website.

162064.name: Fat Roll Santa
162064.description:
Santa is back, and he's fatter than ever. ...And rollier than ever. Have you been good?

Controls
- Hold the device upright
- Tilt left and right to move as you fall
- Collect presents, avoid spikes

Features
- Fully Game Center compatible
- Advanced world generation: never play the same level twice!
- Online leaderboards and several challenging achievements
- Realistic physics
- Facebook support: post your scores to your profile
- Extremely simple controls: just tilt to move!
- Beautiful “world-sized” backgrounds that change as you go
- Endless style play: keep going as long as you can!
- An energetic new take on familiar Christmas songs

Advanced Tips
- Get all of the presents in an area for a “Perfect!”
- A Perfect! causes you to briefly earn extra points from collectibles.
- Play quickly after a Perfect! to maximize your bonus points.
- Try to get the GIANT present at the end of each level for major points.
- Tilting the device back and forth quickly while bouncing off obstacles will cause you to build momentum and reach higher places.

Source: The Developer Website.

162065.name: Fates Forever
162065.description:
User Summary

Fates Forever is a multiplayer online battle arena game (3v3) in which players join teams and complete in real-time online games against other players. Controlling one of the 8 animal heroes, players will destroy towers, capture shrines, cast spells, and attempt to claim victory.

162066.name: Zombieville USA 2
162066.description:
User Summary

This sequel to Zombieville USA allows you and a friend to once again take command of your favorite character and go into battle against the living dead. Pick up your gun and begin killing all the zombies in town in this side-scrolling arcade-style shooting game.

162067.description:
Like all members of the 18xx family, this game is played in alternating stock rounds, where players buy and sell shares in multiple corporations, and sets of operating rounds, where the corporations operate on the map and possibly pay dividends to their shareholders. At the end of the game the player with the greatest net worth in stock value and cash holdings wins.

This is 18xx on a large scale - 40 railroad companies, two oversize map sheets, 825 tiles, 480 cards (stock shares, trains, private corporations), and a play time to match.

This game takes the "D" variant of 18C2C: Manifest Destiny and reimplements it on an even larger map (the US, Canada, and Mexico) with a variety of rule changes to provide play variability and balance, most notably player-driven upgrade paths for cities (so that cities will grow to different values in different games) providing new sources of tension in the stock rounds.

Game features taken from 18C2C: Manifest Destiny include a reservation auction for private companies (similar to 1830), full capitalization, company destinations (somewhat similar to the destinations in 1870), corporate share redemption, and two types of mergers (voluntary mergers between pairs of companies, and two involuntary mergers of failed railroads into government railroads). High-level "D" trains run short routes (3 to 6 cities) and double the values, simplifying route building and calculation.

Intended publication is set for 2015 as a full commercial production similar to 18OE, and possibly a conversion kit to include only those components different from 18C2C: Manifest Destiny.
162067.name: 18C2C: Continental Empires

162068.name: Arkhangelsk
162068.description:
In Arkhangelsk you play a team of soldiers sent to Arkhangelsk to find out why it is no longer responding to communications. At the beginning of the game you just arrived in the camp. You need to get the power on, radio working, and call for evacuation.

On each turn you will draw cards from your deck to gain time to take actions like moving, firing, repairing and searching. You can also use the time to refine your tactics by purchasing cards. The cards in your hand give you both time to take actions and better or more efficient actions.

As the game progresses your deck will become stronger, but the storm will increase in intensity, the sun will set, and stronger creatures will venture forth from the surrounding Siberian wastes.

You will need to balance all your actions carefully to survive the elements, repair the prison, kill the winter creatures and finally make a dash for the airstrip when the plane lands!

162069.name: Ghostcontrol Inc.
162069.description:
A hilarious ghost-hunting simulation

Manage a team of ghosthunters and free London from paranormal terror in turn-based battles. Develop your own strategy and build your business well.

Let's be honest - a ghost in your house can be a real pest. For centuries we have accepted hauntings as unexplained phenomena which we can do little to stop. Side affects of living in a haunted home can include sleepless nights, headaches, smog everywhere and in some cases even physical damage in the house.

Enough is enough, with your help we intend to put an end to these paranormal pests. Build, manage and develop your own team of talented ghost hunters.

With the income from your team's work you can equip them with some amazing gadgets, but manage your budget with care not everything is as useful as it may appear. Hunt your customers ghosts down - property damage should be kept to a minimum. Take on the ghosts, follow the map, take in the lovely sites and stunning landmarks.

Be the hero of the day and save the city!

Background information:
The developers of GhostControl Inc. are big fans of classic games such as GhostBusters, the original XCOM, Theme Hospital and FTL.
In it's classic pixel art retro style the game comes with outstanding original graphics and a funny story line.

GhostControl Inc. Backstage
Some data

London Map pixeled in 786,432 dots with several well known buildings like Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, London Eye, St Paul's Cathedral and many more.

Different level settings like apartment, office, graveyard, The Tube or restaurant will create different challenges for the player.

About 150 ghost hunter portraits for "Harry Frankle“, "Hazel Nuts“ or "Roger Rapid“ - some of them depicting well known gaming celebrities.

About 20 hours of game play.

18 different ghost types and numerous variations with nifty AI. Challenging boss fights with special scripting and a story line for each of them.

More than 58 achievements.

Alarm phone calls start a mission with a unique dialogue systems that creates about 70,000 unique dialogues. On top 800 hand written crazy phone call lines for surprises and to develop the story line.

More than 350 funny context sensitive shoutouts that pop up in speech bubbles and as audio, recorded with female and male voices of professional voice actors.

Over 100 hidden references to other classical video games, movies or books are hidden as text or graphics in the game.

We have created over 90 devices of which most are actually useful in the game and a few dozen are actually pretty useless, but funny.

About 100 news messages are sent to the in-game smartphone to tell players about the story line or some absurd 100% made up stories that the player may or may not read. Also presenting 20 manufacturers of ghost hunting equipment in company profiles.

Original music score composed by Sound Of Games.

Over 100 hand crafted original sound effects.

Features:

True, challenging turn-based strategy gameplay
Loads of ghost hunting with various equipment
Team management and strategic investment decisions
AI driven competing teams
A London city map with famous landmarks
Tons of humour in text messages and game action
Original game music soundtrack

Source: The Game Website.

162070.description:
Teruel, 1171. The village of Teruel is founded and centuries of cohabitation began among three cultures: Christians, Jews and Muslims. Under the conditions of the Fuero of Teruel (Teruel’s laws), the three cultures kept their traditions alive, living their legacy in the streets and in the history of the city.


Populi Turolii is a game for 3 to 8 players. You are an influential person in your community and you must take care of your people’s interests throughout some events, without breaking the balance of power among the three cultures. The winner is the one who achieves the objectives written in his/her character card at the end of one of the rounds.
Components of the game:

1 Rulebook.
96 Cards.




Playing the game:

The game is divided into a variable number of rounds, which are composed of different stages:


Stage 1: Negotiations
Each player looks at each of the three events that are on the table. The players can negotiate and try to persuade the others to deal with the rest of the events.
Stage 2: Decision-making
Beginning by the first player and clockwise, each player chooses one of his game cards and places it face-up on one of the events. This action must be repeated until all players have played all their cards.


Stage 3: Scoring
Once all the cards have been assigned, all the events must be checked one by one, analyzing the game cards placed on them.
After checking the three events, the total movement of each culture must be calculated. Now check if any player has won. In this case, the game ends.
162070.name: Populi Turolii
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ62: Populi Turolii (2014) Luis Valleaguado

162071.description:
Vaults is a fun and easy to learn card game, set in the steampunk world. Two to four players assume the role of the crime lords and compete to become the richest of all.

To do so, they need to recruit safe crackers and use their skills to crack vaults. Some vaults are easy straightforward jobs, fit for a small crew, while others are more challenging and demand larger crew equipped with tools.

Every crime lord needs to choose who to recruit carefully. Crew bosses and crew members use their various abilities and can change the outcome of the game.

The game is based on the Action management mechanic, where almost every move is considered an action. With the right planning and a bit of luck, every action can lead to high rewards.

Vault card game includes:

30 Crew member cards – with numerous skills and abilities

8 Crew boss cards – each with their own unique ability

10 Disrupt cards – with multiple choice effects

20 Tool cards – no crew is complete without one

27 Vault cards – with different difficulty and crack outcomes

4 Turn sequence / character summary cards
162071.name: Vaults

162072.name: The Peides Curse: Earth
162072.description:
The Peides Curse: Earth is a strategic and tactical game in which players take on the role of heroes who are embarking on an audacious and dangerous rescue mission. They face the uncertainty of time travel that bring them to the future year of 2223 where they will join the Spirit and fight a tough battle to stop the power of Evil. In order to accomplish the objective of their mission, the players shall participate in the race of their lives to find 9 secret codes that will stop Evil from wielding its power and destroying Earth.

Each player is required to put into motion his or her most strategic plan and creative cunningness to plot successfully and beat the other players to be the first to find all the secret codes. The game uses two different decks of power card play / power travel to help the players navigate to their designated mission destination. In this phase, players must cleverly maneuver their moves to put into motion their plans and strategy. The game play takes on an infusion of race and prior planning. High levels of strategy deployment or plotting, combined with tactical maneuvers, is required.

In the quest to ﬁnd the secret codes, the players are required to follow the clues which will lead them to where they are hidden. They then need to decipher the code with the decoder dices. Successful attempts shall be rewarded with energy points and battle ﬂags. They are both critical game changing components that will propel the players to lead in the game.

The last phase of the race shall see them being pitted in the battle between the Spirit and Evil. Here, the players will be able to deploy actions or movements that will keep them safe. The battle card may also be a game killer if it is played correctly. The players need to be extra cautious at this stage because they may well fall prey to 3 ‘surprise’ cards in the stack. This can cause them to deplete their Vourton power and lose a turn when they meet face to face with Evil. However, all is not lost. There are saviour cards that will restore the players’ power immediately without losing a turn.

162074.description:
Darkfast Dungeons is a print and play tabletop game designed to provide a robust dungeon crawl experience in a couple of hours. A typical dungeon crawl will last 2-3 hours and provide a unique adventure with each game played.

There are many ways to play Darkfast Dungeons with rules and scenarios for co-operative games, competitive games and solo play.

The Darkfast Dungeons basic set includes 6 heroes, 12 monsters, a full set of game cards, rulebook and 26 customizable 2d tiles.
162074.name: Darkfast Dungeons

162076.name: USR (Unbelievably Simple Roleplaying) Version 2.0
162076.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick and Fun

Sometimes you just want to play a roleplaying game without the hassle of learning a mountain of rules. Unbelievably Simple Roleplaying has the answer. This streamlined ruleset will get you and your friends around the table and on an adventure in no time. With quick and easy mechanics that both new players and veterans will love, USR opens up a gateway to infinite worlds, whether you want to play as detectives in Victorian England, witch hunters in a dark city or warriors in a magical realm.

Play it Your Way

USR is an easy game to learn but there are optional rules throughout if you fancy making it a bit more advanced. Feel free to add your own rules or change current ones to match your preferences. The most important thing is that you and your group have fun with it.

What's New?

What's New In USR Version 2.0? This is the second version of the USR system, and while the game hasn't changed much there have been a couple of alterations. For one, the layout has had a lick of fresh paint. Hope you like it. The second is that using Specialisms during combat has changed to make it even more streamlined. Thirdly, narrative points have been adjusted to offer a more structured way of using them. Finally, after lots of feedback the book now includes more advice for new players starting out with roleplaying games. Other than that, it's all the same, unbelievably simple game you love!

USR 2.0 features:

Super fast character creation
Generic system covering a multitude of genres
Rules-lite gameplay that encourages roleplay
Role-play centric advancement
Quick, modular combat
Simple one-die task resolution
Dynamic rules for any weapon imaginable

162077.name: CATCH-UP!
162077.description: In this children's dexterity game, players use hooks on strings to move plastic fish vertically onto a tree-like structure. The player who completes the task first is the winner.

162078.description: Munchkin Holidazed, Steve Jackson Games' holiday-themed Munchkin booster pack for 2014, contains 15 cards (eleven new cards and four reprinted cards that previously appeared only in the Munchkin Holiday Surprise boxed set), a peppermint-swirled level counter, and six Munchkin dice.
162078.name: Munchkin Holidazed

162079.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 31 - Marzo/Aprile 2001)
rpgissuearticle: La vera storia di Capoccetta rossa e il lupo cattivo
Tra le nebbie del tempo (settima e ultima parte)

162080.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 32 - Estate 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Il Signore degli Anelli. Il film
Stiamo lavorando anche per voi...meglio, stiamo lavorando soprattutto per voi

162081.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 33 - Settembre/Ottobre 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Guerre stellari: "L'attacco dei cloni" è il nuovo episodio

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Board Game of the Year Nominee
2015 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
2015 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
162082.description:
In Deus, players work to develop their own civilizations in a shared environment. Each player starts the game with five building cards, and on a turn a player either uses one of these cards to construct a building or discard one or more cards to make an offering to a god. Cards come in six colors: red for military, green for resource production, blue for trade, brown for scoring, purple for temples, and yellow for a variety of effects.

When you construct a building, you build it in the appropriate location on the modular game board — which is sized based on the number of players with the hexagonal tiles composed of seven landscape "circles" — then you place the card in your personal tableau in the appropriate stack of colored cards and activate the power of all of those cards already in your tableau, starting with the card at the bottom of the stack.

When you make an offering, you discard cards, then receive the help of a god associated with one of the cards that you discarded, with the number of cards determining the strength of the associated action. You then refill your hand to five cards.

The game ends either when all the barbarian villages on the game board have been surrounded and attacked or when all the temples have been constructed. Whoever has the most points wins.
162082.name: Deus

rpgissuearticle: E' tempo di morire...anzi, è tempo di cambiare!

162084.name: Makers
162084.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Makers Sourcebook is an expansion for Vampire: Undeath. Within these pages you'll learn not only how the elders behave and act but also what it means to be a Maker and have to teach and defend your progeny. All of the ins and outs of undead society are listed in these 96 pages!

162085.name: Lyhin
162085.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lyhin Sourcebook is a guide to creating the magical vampires of the Lyhin Bloodline. Created in ancient times, the Lyhin masquerade as other Bloodlines, spreading their influence within undead society. Although they are rumored to be exinct and hunted by the Daemoni, the Lyhin Sourcebook is an invaluable tool for the roleplayer looking for more adventure in their gaming experience.

162086.name: House Nicolai
162086.description:
From publisher blurb:

The House Nicolai is about Necromancy, dark arts and Voodoo. Telling the tale of Nicolai, one of the most infamous vampires formerly of the Daemoni Bloodline, the Sourcebook tells the tale of how Nicolai was a gifted Thaumaturge who was given special privilage from the Loa. Ancient spirits who taught Nicolai the arts required to free himself from his dark masters. The Daemoni have tried to exterminate the members of the House Nicolai since they left.

The House Nicolai helped spread Voodoo and Necromancy through the known world among their mortal counterparts. Moving from the Carpathians to Africa to the Carribean, the members of House Nicolai craft their arts and spread their influence through the world.

In these dark nights, nothing is more fearesome than the name Daemoni. Nothing, that is, except the vampires who can control other vampires. The House Nicolai rules both a mortal sect and immortal sect, spreading their influence and helping those who deserve it. Using ancestral magic, House Nicolai is here to stay.

162087.name: Cherche
162087.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cherche are a brotherhood of adventurous, law-bending, adrenaline-addicted vampires. Dedicating their undead lives to a Coven, Cherche are often found in small packs running the streets and causing problems. Deciding the Blood Laws are open to interpretation, Cherche are often a plague on the streets within their territories, walking a fine line between keeping the Blood Laws and violating them.

When choosing from the mortal world, Cherche take first from those who lived in the limelight but fell too soon. Injured surfers, skaters, bikers, etc are first choice to become a Cherche given a new lease on life. It is through this life that each Coven parties the night away and enjoys their unlife to the fullest.

With no real single Dark Gift, Cherche are the only one of the three modern Bloodlines to wield three Dark Gifts, although they are somewhat less powerful in contrast. Cherche are the vampires most summoned to a Great House and the first to start a war between the vampires of a territory and the Werewolves. Within the Midwest the Mahigan (werewolves) are at war with the Cherche and the war shows no signs of slowing down (as referenced in the City of Interest: Grand Rapids Sourcebook).

162088.name: Obia
162088.description:
From publisher blurb:

Turned, you were given the Gift of Iblis and resurrected as a Shadow Vampire. As a denizen of the Shadow World you must use Darkness and feed on the shadow of a mortal soul. As you explore your character and traverse the worlds, you’ll discover that sometimes, even monsters have something to fear.

In this book you will discover how to play an Obia in the modern nights, build your skills and face deadly foes. Fight back the Darklings, repair the tears between the worlds and remain faithful to your House.

162089.name: Fallen: The Devils of Hell
162089.description:
From publisher blurb:

You died. But death is not the end. As you were traveling to the Afterlife something happened and you were snatched up and brought to Hell. Given a second chance at life, you’re now a soldier of Hell, sworn to a Fallen Angel to fight in a war between Angels and Demons, between light and darkness.

In this book you will discover how to play a Devil in the modern nights, build your skills and face deadly foes. Join a war that has been raging on since the dawn of time and discover which side you’ll fight for.

162090.name: I, Damiano: The Wizard of Partestrada
162090.description:
User Summary

Your a young warlock living in the Italian city of Partestrada. But nefarious forces are at work to bring the downfall of the city. To save the city you must find a sacred stone which contains the secrets of life. Satan will give you a hand, Do you accept?

This is a Text Adventure with graphics.

Based on a Novel by R.A. MacAvoy

162091.name: I.O. Silver
162091.description:
From the manual

The object of I. O. Silver is to move the Professor around the screen and push together all of the chips of the same color, thus combining them and creating other parts which ultimately create a Super Computer. For each Super Computer built, you get a hi-res medal and tons of imaginary cash.
Short of that lofty goal, the object is to survive and earn as much money as possible by combining as many chips and other computer parts as you can.

You may play two different versions of I. O. Silver-the high-pressure "ARCADE WORKSHOP" or the take-your-time "STRATEGY LAB".

162092.name: Espresso Fishing
162092.description:
Espresso Fishing doesn't ask you to fish with caffeinated drinks — no, instead you use the espresso to keep yourself awake when you're out on a hot lake fishing for hours at a time. To get the fish, though, you need to first test your luck with the dice...

Each turn, the active player rolls three blue dice and two red dice. After the first roll, she can roll each die individually at most one more time. After doing this, she can either fish or poach depending on what she's rolled. If she has at least one hook, one worm and a wave, she can fish by rolling the white die — and she rolls it a number of times equal to the product of the hooks and waves that she has. The white die features 1-2 fish, a boot (which nets you nothing for that roll), and the sweet ZZZZZZs of someone who fell asleep; catch the Zs and your fishing time ends immediately. If you use one of your two espresso tokens prior to rolling, however, Zs become boots and you can keep rolling.

When you roll a full house or four- or five-of-a-kind, you can steal 1-3 fish from other players. With a special full house, you can reclaim an espresso chip or move one fish from the lake or another player's pile.

Once the lake is empty, whoever has the most fish wins. In a tie, the tied player holding the yellow fish wins — but if neither of them has the yellow fish, then they're out of the game and the player with the nextmost fish wins!

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
162093.description:
Yet again, a ravening horde of horrible zombies has shambled forth to devour the living. It must be a day of the week that ends in ‘y’.

In I Hate Zombies., 2-12 players face off in a climactic battle for the very fate of the world that will last between 10 and 20 minutes. Some of the players will be the noble last survivors of humanity, while others will be dirty, wretched brain-guzzling zombies. To see who survives, they will engage in that time-honored tradition, that Sport of Kings...

Yes, that's right. Rock-Paper-Scissors. To the Death!

Although the valiant humans each have a special ability to aid them in their struggle to survive, the zombies are tougher to kill, and humans they kill turn into more zombies, and certainly let us not forget the spleen-churning stench.

While the game could be succinctly described as Rock-Paper-Scissors with special abilities, the abilities add some interesting decision making for the zombie players as to which humans to focus their brain munching beam on, and when. So, while the game uses the RPS mechanism, there are real and interesting decisions to be made which will have the zombies debating their strategy (or at least as well as their limited mental capacity allows).

If you hate zombies (and you should!), you'll find altogether more zombies than you're comfortable with in I Hate Zombies.

"I had all the guns, ammo, and canned food I could ever need. Why didn't anyone tell me I also needed to brush up on my bluffing skills?!"
-Last Words of Survivalist Joe

I Hate Zombies. is game #1 in the BGG Micro Series.
162093.name: I Hate Zombies
boardgameexpansion: I Hate Zombies: Spyke and Geek
I Hate Zombies: We Hate Zombies Too
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 12 - Ticket to Ride Europe

162094.name: Panga Class Merchant
162094.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book details the Panga Class Merchant, one of the many thousands of merchant vessels plying the space lanes across known space. It is a small vessel, but with the ability to fit various pods, so it can carry more and be adapted to different roles.

Contains:

A description and guided tour of the vessel
Details of 3 notable ships of the class
3 versions of the Panga with complete deckplans, specifications and game sheets
An example crew with complete game stats
New equipment, inlcuding a shotgun and two ATVs.




Included as seperate files are A3 sized, technical blueprints, deckplan (blueprint style) and 15mm scale black and white plans on A3 size sheets

162095.name: Cedarwood
162095.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let’s face after multiple dungeon delves and wilderness encounters you just want to spend some of that hard won loot. If your party has been out in the wilderness a little too long the high walls of a frontier city is a welcome sight. Such is the case with the large community of Cedarwood in the Plains of Dorack. At 46 pages of locales if the PCs can’t find something interesting, they need a cure blindness spell!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for any level adventurer and DM. This adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

162096.name: Andju Village
162096.description:
From publisher blurb:

With your adventurers growing up it only makes sense that their surroundings should also grow. Such is the case of Andju Village which is being controlled by the newly created Viscount of Andju, Sir Dimek of Rastinstein. Sir Dimek has launched an ambitious building project with the intent to make his village a trading powerhouse. This area can be utilized as a base of operations near the frontier and be a safe haven for a party of explorers.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for any level of adventurer. This setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

162097.name: Mythic Mummies
162097.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beware the Wrath of the Mummy!

Perhaps one of the first things that one thinks of when considering Egyptian settings is the mummy, one of the most iconic undead creatures in all of fantasy media. These bandage-wrapped guardians are often portrayed as being imbued with great power by their transformation. But in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, their low CR and simple stat-block prevent them from living up to the myths and legends that surround them.

This book introduces two new kinds of non-mythic mummies: the dry mummy, which forms naturally from those who die of exposure in the desert, and has the power to drain life-giving moisture from their victims, and the pitch mummy, a foul undead animated by black tar, whose creation was considered taboo even by those who extolled the virtues of creating normal mummies. In addition to the non-mythic versions, mythic versions of each of these creatures is provided as well, making it easy to use them in a wider variety of game styles and at a significant range of CRs.

162098.name: Desert Temple: Iunu
162098.description:
From publisher blurb:

A printable geomorphic dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: Four 10x10 battlemaps depicting Ancient Egyptian-style temples, corridors and chambers. Dedicated to the Scarab beetle, these temples are full of iconography and heiroglyphics.

Uses: Explore the lost ruins of Egypt, bring an artefact to the Priests in the temple, escape the tomb of the Pharaoh with the Mummy's treasure, unlock puzzles and ancient secrets, dare to awaken the Grand Hierophant, discover if there really is a 'Curse of the Mummy', seek a blessing of the spirits still haunting the temple complex.

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

162099.name: The Forsworn
162099.description:
From publisher blurb:

Paladin Alternate Class

Forsworn are virginal female paladins who are gifted with the companionship of a unicorn. They feature enhanced spell-casting abilities at the cost of some of their martial abilities and draw from a more druid-ish spell list to show their dedication to nature. Not a woman? No problem! You can either play as a eunuch or use the rules for a "challenger". Challengers are the male counterpart of a forsworn who gain a Pegasus mount rather than a unicorn.

So! If you ever wanted to ride a unicorn, and we know you have, be sure to pick up the Forsworn goblin ration this weekend!

162100.name: Modern Home II
162100.description:
From publisher blurb:

Part two of a larger collection of modern homes for use with any modern gaming system. This is a four bedroom, two and a half bath, two story modern home set in a rural suburban neighborhood meant to be used in any generic setting, up to and including the break out of an apocalypse of some sort. Perhaps this home is occupied by one or more of your players and they must defend themselves against attack by their enemies who have hunted them to their own sanctuary? Or perhaps the players themselves are hunting someone and have tracked that individual here, to this house. Maybe your players are surviving the early stages of a zombie apocalypse and you need a house for them to scavenge supplies (...and encounter a few zombies...) in? Whatever your needs, any modern setting needs houses, which is what the Modern Homes series is all about. Stay tuned for more homes (big and small) in the near future!

Features:

15" x 20" in size. Perfectly sized for any playing surface!
HEX and SQUARE grids for each type of map listed below, as well as a NO GRID version for people that prefer to set their own scale. Grid sizes are 1" = 5' of gaming space.
Full Color Version – This is a printer intensive, full color version of this map.
Black and White version – A black and white version, meant to be the least printer intensive.
Daytime lighting complete with shadows to give the map depth.
VTT Map - Sized for use with any virtual table top software. Both the first and second floors are included.

162101.name: Modern Home I
162101.description:
From publisher blurb:

Part one of a larger collection of modern homes for use with any modern gaming system. This is a three bedroom, two bath single family modern home set in a rural suburban neighborhood meant to be used in any generic setting, up to and including the break out of an apocalypse of some sort. Perhaps this home is occupied by one or more of your players and they must defend themselves against attack by their enemies who have hunted them to their own sanctuary? Or perhaps the players themselves are hunting someone and have tracked that individual here, to this house. Maybe your players are surviving the early stages of a zombie apocalypse and you need a house for them to scavenge supplies (...and encounter a few zombies...) in? Whatever your needs, any modern setting needs houses, which is what the Modern Homes collection is all about. Stay tuned for more homes (big and small) in the near future!

Features:

30" x 30" in size. Two and a half feet squared when printed out. Perfectly sized for any playing surface!
HEX and SQUARE grids for each type of map listed below, as well as a NO GRID version for people that prefer to set their own scale. Grid sizes are 1" = 5' of gaming space.
Full Color Version – This is a printer intensive, full color version of this map.
Black and White version – A black and white version, meant to be the least printer intensive.
Daytime lighting complete with shadows to give the map depth.
VTT Map - Sized for use with any virtual table top software. Both the first and second floors are included.

162102.name: Rapine, Pillage & Plunder
162102.description:
Europe, c. 450 A.D. Barbarians are running amok, raiding villages for women (rapine), weapons (pillage) and gold (plunder). Will your tribe reign supreme in this savage contest for survival?

Game play alternates between the players. On your turn, you have a choice of three actions:


Rapine, pillage or plunder (RPP)
