Move
Discard a card


The cards serve the three above purposes. Most of the time, players will move to villages and perform RPP. Sometimes, however, when a barbarian tribe gets a little cocky, a battle will occur between the players. These are settled smoothly using the symbols on the cards in hand, and rest assured--tribute will be paid by the loser!

I designed Rapine, Pillage & Plunder because I feel there's a dearth of fun, light, yet not-too-simple two-player games. I believe that this game helps fill that void. (Publishers take note). It's a simple game aimed at casual gamers but has enough in the way of tactics and choices to appeal to more seasoned gamers, as well.

162103.name: Krigs-spelet, grundadt på Bülows nyare krigs-systems esprit
162103.description: Game about military operations played on a grid with terrain drawn on. Units are brigades formed into three different armies for each player, plus Generals that are needed to activate units. There are also forts and magazines on the map. Tracing of supplies and communication are important to winning the game. The goal is to capture the opponent's main fort. Combat is deterministic, decided by having more units attacking or defending, modified by terrain, forts, or having elite units in the battle.

162104.name: 3-Fun Yosou Umaban Club
162104.description:
Sanpun Yosō Umaban Club (３分予想 馬番倶楽部) is a Japanese horse racing video game developed and published by Hect for the Game Boy exclusively in Japan. It was released in Japan on Oct 16, 1992 and never saw a release in another territory. The game allows players to place bets on horse races.

Source: Wikipedia, "3-Pun Yosō Umaban Club", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

162105.name: Medarot: Kabuto Version
162105.description:
Medabots, known in Japan as Medarot (メダロット Medarotto), is a role-playing video game franchise developed by Natsume and published by Imagineer in Japan in 1997. The video game franchise was later adapted into a Japanese anime television series produced by Bee Train. Spanning 52 episodes, the series originally aired on TV Tokyo from July 2, 1999 until June 30, 2000.

Medabot: Kuwagata Version (also available in a Kabuto Version), which started the Medabots series, is a role-playing game that Natsume developed and Imagineer released in Japan in 1997 to the Game Boy handheld gaming system on November 28, 1997. A remake of the game, Medabot: Perfect Edition, was released to the WonderSwan on May 4, 1999.

Source: Wikipedia, "Medabots", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

162107.description:
Doodle City is a quick family game of city building. By drawing a network of roads on their play sheet, players are building a city and trying to score points for their hotels, shops and taxis — all while avoiding pollution.

Working out an ideal road network can be quite the puzzle, so before the game begins roads through parks are randomized, making sure that no two games will be alike. Each round, one white die per player, one additional white die, and a blue die are rolled onto the table. The blue die indicates which column the players must use, while each white die indicates a row. In turn each player picks a white die and draws in the given space. In most spaces you draw roads, but in parks you instead build houses. You can draw only once in each space, and if on your turn you cannot draw, you gain pollution.

A building is scored the moment you draw in its space. For example, when you draw a road through a hotel space, you score points equal to the length of the road passing through that hotel. Shops score according to how many houses are currently connected to the shop. There are also bonuses awarded to the first player who connects a shop to a certain number of houses.

The game ends when one player completes the highest possible hotel or shop score, or when a player loses his last tree due to pollution. Final scores are for connected taxis and for having least/most pollution.
162107.name: Doodle City
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 35: The Battle at Kemble’s Cascade and Gaming with Kids
Essen 2014 - Doodle City
The Game Pit: Episode 32 - Essen 2014 Treasure Hunt Special (part 2)
The Spiel #200 - CC
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 19!!!

162108.name: Able Archer
162108.description:
Able Archer is wargaming systém, which will put players into role of company or battalion commanders durning fictional conflict in 1983. You will assume command of NATO or WARPAC ground forces. You will lead tanks,infantry but even artillery or airforces. You will be fighting in conflict that was greatest fear of every politican and commander durning Cold war. Can you defeat Soviets before they could reach the Rhine? Or will you lead final push towards the Paris as Soviet commander?
Able Archer unlike many games situated in Cold war gone hot scenário, is played in 1:1 scale. That means 1 vehicle represent one vehicle, base of infantry represents team and so on.
In smaller games you will lead companies, while in larger games you can command battalions or even regiment worth of troops.

162110.name: 3 Choume no Tama: Tama and Friends - 3 Choume Obake Panic!!
162110.description:
User Summary

You are playing as a little cat running through a city. Try to avoid cars and bad dogs while finding all your animal friends.
Increase the amount of hits you can take by playing a few mini-games.

162111.name: Air Fleet: Knights of the Sky
162111.description: Air Fleet is a game of aerial combat of the second world war. The players control a squadron of aircraft. This squadron is generally composed of two or three aircraft. The goal is to maneuver on the game table in order to destroy the greatest number of enemy aircraft. There is no limit to the number of players, however it is advised to have only one squadron per player.

162112.name: Counter Terrorist Force
162112.description:
Counter-Terrorist Force is a pure “player vs. player” (1 on 1) game where the main focus is on tactics and realistic combat. The game is played from both sides of the conflict. One person plays the terrorists and the other takes the role of counter-terrorist.
Not only do you execute missions, you also run your own counter terrorist corporation and try to work your way up from scratch. You will also fight occasionally as a terrorist so that your friends can
play as counter terrorist troopers too. Game play can either be single missions to improve your corporation, or otherwise in campaign mode where two campaigns are interwoven – you and your opponent take turns as terrorists - and you both have your own counter-terrorist unit to run every second game in your individual campaign.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Familien Recommended
162114.description: In the tricky card game Hamsterbacke, players want to collect as many sets of cards as possible, store them away, and pick up extra points from other players — but those who are too greedy might find themselves left behind. In the end, whoever collects the most points wins.
162114.name: Hamsterbacke
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2014 - Amigo

162115.name: Demon Gaze II
162115.description:
User Summary

Demon Gaze 2 is an rpg dungeon crawler that will have game-play similar to its predecessor.

162116.name: Tonnage War Solitaire
162116.description: Tonnage War Solitaire is a solitaire game simulating the great North Atlantic convoy battles of 1942-43. The player controls the anti-submarine escorts protecting a convoy of Allied merchantmen, while the German U-boats attacking the convoy are portrayed through the mechanics of the game system.

162117.name: When Empires Clash
162117.description: A set of rules for using 15mm scale model figures when fighting small late 19th and early 20th century colonial battles.

162118.name: Typhoon: Modern Air Combat
162118.description:
Typhoon is a set of miniatures rules for modern jet combat, specifically designed as an introductory level game for those gamers who wish to use the most current aircraft, but to not get bogged down in the complexity of hi-tech jet warfare. The game’s systems allow each player to control several jets in a fast paced game that can be easily completed in a few hours.

Modern jet combat, particularly with aircraft such as the F-22, Eurofighter, and SU-35 can be extremely complex with the wide variety of radars, ECM, DDS, weapons, etc., which can bring a game to a crawl when using these planes. Typhoon attempts to incorporate the technology into the various game systems which lets the players fly and fight their jets without having to worry about whether or not you have enough chaff or flares still left in your dispensers to defeat the enemy’s next attack.

This makes Typhoon an ideal way to get new gamers into the modern jet combat era as they can focus on the basics of jet
combat instead of memorizing a two page sequence of play. The game is designed to be used without a hex mat or special stands, so this will let gamers use any miniatures that they have and however they are currently mounted for the game.

Hopefully, Typhoon will introduce gamers to the exciting world of hitech jet combat and let them use some of the most powerful aircraft in aviation history in a fun and fast moving game.

162120.description: Tactics, risk and luck of the dice all play a role in the dice/card game combination that is Schraube Locker. The cards indicate their specific value and the numbers that need to be rolled to claim them, therefore you need to roll precicely the required numbers. But beware not to overstep your mark. A complete circling and card sets bring additional points, and the player with the most points wins.
162120.name: Schraube Locker

162121.name: LEGO The Hobbit
162121.description:
Rear Game Cover:

Join Bilbo Baggins, Gandalf, Thorin and his company of dwarves in an epic adventure across Middle-Earth to recapture the Lonely Mountain in the most expansive LEGO game to date.

162122.name: Unheroic Samurai
162122.description: These are rules for playing a wargame with toy soldiers. It is intended for several players - say 4 or more. Players control significant leaders – the key samurai of a clan, who in turn have contingents of fighters under them. These brave samurai find themselves opposed by hordes of undead horrors – the Oyoma.

162123.name: Flanders Fields
162123.description:
War Games Rules for the Great War.

The Great War has never attracted the attention of war-gamers in the same way that conflicts both before and since have done. There are probably a number of reasons for this but the common perception, especially in the UK, that Great War battles were little more than exercises in mass slaughter ordered by remote and uncaring generals probably has much to do with the reluctance to game this period.
These views are now being re-appraised by a fresh generation of historians and researchers who, without playing down the horrors of the trenches, the scale of the suffering or the terrible cost of a "Big Push", are challenging many previously held ideas.

Flanders Fields is a set of rules which allows players to war game actions from Regiment (Brigade), to Divisional level actions from the war on the western front between 1914 and 1918.

The rules seek to provide an enjoyable gaming experience for all players, regardless of the final result. As such a degree of sportsmanship is necessary between players, it is perfectly acceptable to seek to slaughter the toy soldiers on the table top but in dealings with other players please maintain a degree of sportsmanship. In cases where the interpretation of a rule might be in doubt, for instance whether a unit is in or out of range let the roll of a die or toss of a coin decide.
The rules are divided into four main sections
A brief consideration of those aspects of the Great War which serve to distinguish it from previous and later conflicts.
The main body of the rules.
Generic tables of divisional organisation which may be used to pick forces for a game.
A number of appendices providing extra information and examples.

162124.name: Coal, and the Kaiser
162124.description:
Coal, and the Kaiser is a naval warfare simulation portraying naval surface warfare in the period 1904-1918. The simulation presents aspects of this warfare through a series of scenarios.

Scenario generators provided with the game can be used to create scenarios typical for the time and place that the game covers.

The game presents these battles on a tactical, ship-to-ship level. The game is for two sides: each controlling the ships of a contending naval force. Ships are represented by 1/6000 scale miniatures, with any 4 foot by 6 foot level surface serving as a playing area. Movement and combat are conducted in accordance with these rules of play.

162125.name: Starship Strike
162125.description:
These rules are designed for a player to control many capital ships in a major fleet action. They are designed to allow players to refight the huge space battles of the Exterminator War.

There are a couple of other sets of Universe-based rules already in existence.

HELLFIRE, which allows players to control a single ship in considerable detail.
Big Burn is for small fleet actions with a degree of detail as to what damage is done.




This set of rules are another step in the abstraction process, designed to make a battle playable in an hour or less, and several battles in a campaign context practical in an evening.
The basic rules concept is a direct steal from the excellent WRG game 'Seastrike' published in, I think 1974.

Inevitably, that original system has mutated somewhat in its conversion to the Universe, and this system is an attempt to reflect the doctrine and practice of 300+ years of space combat in the Universe.

Space battles in the Universe generally take place in the orbital space around a colony world. Combat is generally not 'to the death', and fleets will usually withdraw if overmatched.

Combat is also very greatly influenced by political constraints and the consequent rules of engagement. Similarly, the loss of a capital ship is a major economic loss as it takes a year and a half to build a replacement, and it has significant credit value. (See the Macro Rules for the Humanity Will Prevail Campaign). Captains and admirals are schooled with the prevailing ethos – which is that if an enemy ship breaks off combat you let it go (after all, it might be you next time).
Much of this was challenged during the Exterminator War – where the enemy was an implacable machine intelligence – so when fighting Exterminators the loss of ships is expected. However, that specific threat has now receded.

162126.name: Skunny: Lost in Space
162126.description:
User Summary

Skunny: Lost in Space is a 2D scrolling game in which Skunny the squirrel drives a space buggy along a variety of long levels that include obstacles, pits, and enemies. The player must jump the buggy on time to avoid pits, shoot a limited number of bullets at a time to remove enemies, and survive the (slow) trek through (long) levels.

162127.name: Skunny: Desert Raid
162127.description:
User Summary

Skunny: Desert Raid follows Skunny on a combat mission to destroy the 'weapons of mass destruction' that are being hoarded by the evil 'Sadman Insane.' It is a top-down railroad shooter in which Skunny's airplane has an unlimited number of bullets, limited resilience against enemy fire, and no resistance to crashing into palm trees. It is also known for being incredibly difficult as well as politically offensive regarding the real-world Gulf War events of the 1990s.

162128.name: Skunny: Save our Pizzas
162128.description:
User Summary

In Skunny: Save our Pizzas, Skunny travels back in time to Rome to rediscover the recipe for pizza, which an evil chef has somehow forced everyone in the present day to forget.
Skunny must work his way through levels filled with centurions, spears, and other ancient obstacles, so as to piece together the recipe in order to bring it back to the present day.

162129.name: Skunny: Wild West
162129.description:
User Summary

Skunny: Wild West follows Skunny after the events of Skunny: Save our Pizzas. After recovering the recipe for pizza in ancient Rome, Skunny attempts to travel back to his home time. Unfortunately, he gets stuck in 1909 where his father is suffering from the acts of a sheep thief. Skunny sets out on a new adventure to recover his father's sheep and thus restore things to their proper order before travelling to his present time with the pizza recipe.

This game is a side scrolling platformer, much like Save our Pizzas, with Skunny being able to run like Sonic the Hedgehog. Skunny must avoid enemies and can jump on their heads, as in other Skunny games.

162130.name: Snake
162130.description:
User Summary

Snake is another version of the classic Snake game, written by Abhijeet Meshram in 2007. It features most of the same elements of the original, with the snake growing longer with each consumed egg and the game ending with a crash of the ever-moving snake into a wall or himself. The walls wrap around in this version and there is a bonus blue egg that temporarily appears occasionally.

162131.name: Snake
162131.description:
User Summary

This is another version of the classic Snake game, in which a snake travels around a 2D level consuming fruit and growing longer with each consumed treat. In this version, all sides of the level will wrap to the other side and there are often walls that block direct movement without wrapping somehow on a level.

This version was written by Ilija Mihajlov in 2012.

162132.name: Snow White's Voyage
162132.description:
User Summary

Snow White's Voyage is a side scroller aimed at an audience of young girls, according to the publisher. The protagonist is Snow White who is voyaging through a land fraught with danger. She is able to throw rings at enemies, which must be collected on each level. One difficulty is that Snow White can only hold 12 rings at a time. Also, she will die from a single close encounter with an enemy.

162133.name: Solitile
162133.description:
User Summary

Solitile is a Mahjongg Solitaire game from the 1980s with an EGA colourset. It uses English characters for letters and numbers, which differs from many Mahjongg Solitaire games. A player can choose a setup using as few tiles as four and as many as 168. This allows for a great variety in games as well as difficulty.

162134.name: Space Chase (1993)
162134.description:
User Summary

Space Chase is a 2D side-scroller much like Crystal Caves or Secret Agent. The hero, Jason Storm, is a marine who is up against "Evil Guys Inc." who create dangerous robots and hire monsters to further their plans. Jason Storm has limited ammunition in each level, but he can jump amazingly high. Levels are filled with jewels and other bonuses as well, providing incentives to risk for high scores.

162135.name: Space Nightmare
162135.description:
User Summary

Space Nightmare is a top down railroad shooter that allows the player to select from a fleet of 3 ships. There is the Dynamite ship, which fires straight ahead and is quick, the Blaster, which is slow but fires a spread shot, and Cancer, which can fire in all directions. All ships can pick up powerups and shields.

In this game, aliens have arrived on Earth, intent on stealing Earth's supplies of copper. Thus, the protagonist is set on a mission to save Earth's economy through the destruction of the invading forces.

162136.name: Spit Wad Willie
162136.description:
User Summary

In Spit Wad Willie, Willie works to remove bouncing balls from the level by rushing underneath them to shoot upwards and destroy them. Balls will bounce to a lower hight each time, forcing Willie to be quick, else they will not bounce high enough for him to zip under and shoot them. Powerups can fall from the sky when the balls are destroyed and Willie has an unlimited number of spit wads.

162137.name: Squarez
162137.description:
User Summary

In Squarez, the player aims to use up all the provided block combinations in a level by placing them on the board. If a set of 3x3 is created, that square will be removed, providing more room for new blocks. Sometimes, bombs, missiles, and other objects are provided, which can help or hinder the player's work.

162138.name: Starfire
162138.description:
User Summary

Starfire is a railroad shooter in which the white space ship flies over and through an alien mothership towards the power core. The power core is, of course, defended by an array of obstacles and enemy ships, which the player must destroy or navigate around. Various powerups can be picked up, including Shields (S), weapon upgrades (W), and temporary invulnerability (I).

162139.name: Sudoku: The Mind Game
162139.description:
User Summary

Sudoku is a rare Sudoku implementation for DOS. It is also notable for being written for DOS in 2005 by Abhijeet Meshram. The game recognizes all the normal Sudoku rules but scores games based on number of 'movements' used to finish a level. There is no mouse support, so movements accumulate rapidly and are not accrued fairly, some would say.

162140.name: Super Angelo
162140.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Super Mario Bros..




User Summary

Super Angelo is a Mario clone for DOS featuring, unashamedly, many of the same game elements as the famous classic. Angelo is on a quest to save a princess from a dragon in the dragon's castle. He has a moustache, travels through tubes in a block-y world, and encounters an array of Koopa-like creatures that block his way.

162141.description:
In Swedish Parliament 2014, you play as one of eight Swedish parties and compete to become the most influential party after the 2014 parliament elections.

The most influential party is the one that becomes the "center of gravity" in the next cabinet. To achieve this, you need as many votes for yourself as possible, but more importantly, you need to have better relations with other parties than they have with each other.

Each turn, you play "idea cards" that move the parties' positions on one of the eight political scales (high tax/low tax, immigration/nationalism etc). Parties who move in concert may strengthen their relation; parties who don't risk weakening theirs. Every move gives the parties more or less favor with the eight voter groups (old/young, men/women etc), which determines the votes cast by the game's sixteen voters (representing every combination of the four voter groups).

The game is an act of balances: Stick out your neck enough to keep a clear profile and win voters that give you political weight, but co-operate enough to place this weight in the right position of the winning coalition.
162141.name: Swedish Parliament 2014
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 38 - The Big Essen 2014 Review

162142.name: Super Ball!
162142.description:
User Summary

Super Ball! was written by Raoul Said in 1992 for DOS. It is a paddle game in which the player repeatedly hits a bouncing ball back up toward an array of bricks which break on contact. Powerups fall when certain bricks are hit and a life is lost when the ball falls off the screen. Occasionally bombs can fall as well, which add another element of peril to the player.

162143.name: The Valley Rule
162143.description:
Controls: Move - Arrows, Jump - S. There are 4 keys, only 1 way out. Collect power-ups to aid in your navigation "Beneath the surface". Made in 72 hours.

Source: The Developer Website.

162144.name: Enchanted Forest Adventure
162144.description:
from the PDF

An old wizard lives in a tower in the enchanted forest. He mostly keeps to himself, but some nights ago at the stroke of midnight, thick, black, toxic smoke has been coming out from his tower, poisoning the air around the forest. You are a young elf sent by your village elders to the enchanted forest to stop the smoke coming from the tower.

162145.name: Bot Colony
162145.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN BETA




This game is in Beta and has not been fully released yet.




It’s 2021, and a devious spy has infiltrated the Pacific sanctuary of the Nakagawa robot company. This secret agent has re-programmed the island’s robots to carry out a terrifying scheme. With only three days left before Armageddon, your help is needed to root out the spy and save Bot Colony.

Source: The Developer Website.

162147.description:
Braiiiins is a 1-6 player game where you control one of six different zombie characters. There are currently 4 different missions to be completed and 2 different modes (Co-op and an indirect player versus player.

Each turn is broken up into three rounds: spawn, locate, and then feed.

During the spawn round, players will all look at the spawning rules for the zombie character they have choosen. Then will then draw a number of zombie allies from the risen deck based on those rules.

During the locate round, players will draw living cards from the living deck. The number of living cards drawn is based on the number of players who started the game. These are who the zombies will feed on!

During the feed round, the players then assign their zombie character and risen cards up against the living cards that are currently in play. Attack and defense characteristics are compared to one another to see who wins the fight! After all fighting actions are resolved, the game turn starts over again.

There are several ways to win: in player versus player mode, you want to be the zombie who has taken the least amount of damage. In our co-op mode, you must successfully complete the choosen scenario before running out of hit points.

Our scenarios range from eliminating the entire town of Risington, to picking off specific members of the town!
162147.name: Braiiiins!
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game of Crowd Funding Fire Squadron Interview 11-05-2014

162148.name: Super ZZT
162148.description:
Super ZZT is the successor to ZZT, created by Allen Pilgrim and Tim Sweeney of Epic Games (then Epic MegaGames). Like its predecessor, Super ZZT was essentially a game creation system with a few games packaged with it, which included Lost Forest, Monster Zoo, and Proving Grounds. Like ZZT, the greatest draw to its sequel was the level editor which allowed players to create their own games. The editor itself was somewhat "hidden" by the creators, perhaps because it was not quite as polished as they wanted in time for the release. It was necessary to add the argument /e to the command line when loading Super ZZT, and then to press E to enter the editor.

Some changes to this version include floor textures, new prefabricated enemies and objects, and scrolling maps, allowing for much larger worlds than ZZT would allow. Although Super ZZT is in many ways a vast improvement over ZZT, it never caught on with the ZZT community like the original ZZT did, and very few games were ever created for Super ZZT. However, notable game creation group Interactive Fantasies did create 3 Super ZZT games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super ZZT", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

162149.name: Superfly
162149.description:
User Summary

In Superfly, you wander around a 2D level swatting the flies in your house with a swatter. Each fly swatted leaves a corpse that blocks that square for movement. If the player is hemmed in by corpses, they lose a swatter.
Each level involves swatting enough small flies to bring in the Superfly, which must be swatted before advancing to the next level.

162150.name: Taking Care of Business
162150.description:
User Summary

Demolisher Dirk aims to reach the exit of each level in Taking Care of Business. The main character most often must climb each 2D level using boxes that must be moved and stacked to allow passage. Other hindrances exist, including disappearing floors, electrical fields, and so on.

162151.name: Talking ABCs: A Day at the Beach
162151.description:
User Summary

Talking ABCs is a safe letter and word game for kids created by Redwood Games in 1992. Games include a speaker announcing a letter for the child to find on the keyboard or images presented where the first letter is required; a matching game where letters are matched to a host of objects; and a mode where objects are spawned based on the letter pressed by the player.

162152.description:
Demonstrate your powers at the yearly gathering of magicians. Seek the aid of magical creatures and use the different abilities their dice give you. Find your way with the aid of valuable spell cards and win the crowning achievement of your craft: the Opus Magnum. But never ever underestimate the power of the dice!

In each round on Ciúb, you will try to make your dice show the combination on one of the spell cards in order to gain victory points. Different faces on the various dice will aid you. After you gain a spell, you will usually need to reduce the number of your dice, so planning ahead for the next round is key. At game end, the player with the most victory points wins!
162152.name: Ciúb
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2014 - Amigo

162153.name: Tetris (1986/DOS)
162153.description:
The first MS DOS version of Tetris was implemented a few days after Alexey put together his first prototype of the game for the Electronica 60. All three of us - Dmitry, Alexey, and I - were fans of Pascal and structured programming despite then-recently-published text "Real Programmers Don't Use Pascal". We used various flavors of Pascal to implement our game ideas. Under MS DOS the development system of choice was Borland's Turbo Pascal. I started learning programming with v1.0. In fact, I still enjoy programming in the descendant of Turbo Pascal - Borland Delphi. The last version of Tetris, we worked on together, was compiled with Turbo Pascal 4. That last version of the game had number 3.12. Although 3.12 is pretty much an arbitrary number as we did not have a strict versioning policy. By the way, this version has an Easter Egg. Although not a sophisticated one. I wonder if anyone can discover it.

The MS DOS version is quite different from the Electronica 60 draft which initially had just the glass and a score count. That version worked on a monochromatic (green/black) alphanumeric display. The tetramino squares were drawn as a pair of square brackets [ ]. Remarkably, the game was playable and addictive even in that form. This gave us a reason to hurry up with the MS DOS implementation. I believe Alexey expanded his Electronica version of the game after we ported it to the PC to match some of the features we had in our PC games. I never worked with Electronica computers myself.

We diligently implemented the MS DOS version of the game in such a way that it could run on any PC we had available. The program ran in a text mode using colored space symbols to represent squares of teraminos. The game could even automatically recognize the IBM monochrome card adjusting the way it drew (printed) on the screen. The clock-frequency race had already started with the introduction of IBM PC AT and PC clones. Many games released for the earlier PC and PC XT (4.77 MHz) models ran too fast on the newer machines. The last version of our game was one of the first to use proper timer delays. 20 years later the same program still runs without any changes, looks and feels the same (especially in the full screen DOS box).

Source: The Developer Website. --Vadim Gerasimov

162155.name: Thor's Hammer
162155.description:
User Summary

Thor's Hammer is a first-person adventure and fighting game. The protagonist wanders around various levels in a dungeon, battling creatures with his equipped axe and magic spells. Dungeon levels are flat and quite large and there is no experience or gold accumulation. Even so, the character becomes stronger as levels progress.

162156.name: Three
162156.description:
User Summary

Three is a Tetris-like game in which bands of colours balls fall from the top of the screen. When sets of three are formed of a single colour, they are removed from the playing area, causing the remaining balls to fall to provide more space for play. A player works to survive as long and generate a high score.

162157.name: Boom Beach
videogamehonor: 2015 D.I.C.E. Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
162157.description:
User Summary:

Boom Beach is a combat strategy game in which players take control of a war base on an island in a tropical archipelago. Players can build and expand their base, upgrading defenses and other buildings, and train elite troops for combat. Other players and computer controlled bases on surrounding islands can be invaded to gain more resources. Boom Beach is similar to the gameplay in Supercell's Clash of Clans and is free to play on iOS and android devices.

162158.name: Three Point Basketball
162158.description:
User Summary

In Three Point Basketball, players try to shoot hoops from the three point line on a basketball court. Using the mouse, the player can adjust the angle and power of the shot which happens in a 2D display. With the final ball out of five worth extra points, a perfect score is 30. There is a hotseat mode for up to four players, a tournament mode, and a practice mode. The computer opponents have names that are close but not quite identical to real-world basketball stars.

162159.description:
Story:
Long ago, the power of five elements was operating in the whole land. Metal manufactured tools. Wood bred creations. Water moisturized lives. Fire warmed world. And Earth created land. Five elements mutually generated and overcame each other. In this circle, all creations within heaven and earth never ended.
In the vast land, only a few people could master all five elements. People called them “The Alchemist”.
One day, the empire held a competition of five elements to find the best alchemist. And you are one of them.
You have to follow the secret book, and use your magic spell and ancient artifact to collect specific element stones. Once you succeed, you will be the best alchemist in the world. But be careful, all your element stones may suddenly token by other alchemists. And your soul and body may be torn apart because of wrong element stones…



Introduction:
In the beginning of the game, players choose their target cards. And in each turn, player moves on the five element map and uses the function card to collect element stones or to do the special function. Players have to reach the alchemy condition on his target card. Once a player reaches his target, then he wins, and the game is over. But if someone reaches the soul-broken condition on his target card, then he has to restart.So, hide you target carefully. And start to enjoy the magic power of Chinese five elements!
162159.name: Alchemist of Five Elements

162160.name: Tile Match
162160.description:
User Summary

Tile Match is a classic tile matching game. There are a number of options available that change the game significantly: there are 3 different sizes of tile, 3 difficulty levels, games with up to 4 players, and tile art can be imported from other games.

162161.name: Tribolo
162161.description:
User Summary

Tribolo is a Reversi game but with 3 players on a 16x11 grid and with unplayable spaces scattered throughout the board. Each player captures opposing pieces by sandwiching a row of pieces with their own colour. The middle pieces cannot be a mix of the other 2 players but must all belong to a single player.

162162.name: Trivia Wiz
162162.description:
User Summary

Trivia Wiz is a trivia game with no specific theme. There are a variety of questions, with 100 questions in each of the 5 volumes available. Bonus points are awarded for answering before the timer reaches zero, but the player can still answer if the time runs out.

162163.name: Trugg
162163.description:
User Summary

In Trugg, the main character is a robot seeking the exit of each level. Unfortunately, the exit remains locked until Trugg can collect every gem in each level. A lattice of mesh fills the level, blocking objects while allowing Trugg to tunnel through; however, blocks, bombs, and other objects can fall or activate depending on where Trugg tunnels. Trugg must be careful not to destroy gems, himself, or the exit using the bombs.

162164.name: Rise of the Drow: GM Screen
162164.description:
Publisher Blurb

Need to know the effects of eating that luminescent mushroom or how many drow arrive to attack the PCs when they attempt to free the slaves? You'll find it all here at your Game Mastery fingertips!

All of the tables, charts, graphs, and goodies appearing within Rise of the Drow are now easily accessible with the Rise of the Drow GM Screen designed as printable inserts and compatible with Hammerdog GM screens.

162165.name: Tubes
162165.description:
User Summary

Tubes is a game much like Tetris or Columns, but it has a number of twists. The premise in Tubes is that Lanny B. Brilliant - a scientist - has created a number of new unstable elements: Redium, Greenium, Bluium, Cyanium, Purplium, Yellowium, Pinkium, and Flashium. These elements need to be reclaimed by being combined together into chains of 3 (called molecules). The atoms flow through a set of six tubes, one at a time, with the player having to catch them in a moveable container that can hold up to five atoms. The container can then be flipped to drop one atom at a time into a beaker, where they are arranged to be removed from play.

162166.name: Myrmidons Invasion of the Giant Mutant Ants
162166.description:
Myrmidons pits two players or two teams of players against each other. One player/team plays the US military forces circa 1950s. The other player/team commands a force of giant mutant ants ala the atomic horror movie classic, Them!

The game is designed for tabletop miniatures play (15mm scale human troops are suggested such as Battlefront Games' WW2 Flames of War (FoW). Counters are provided with the game so that new players or those who don't wish to use miniatures can dive right in.

From the Cover:

Giant mutant ants are in the city sewers and the army must save the day! Play the army commander and use your rifle squads, bazookas, flame throwers - - even mechanized units to eliminate the Ant Queen and her minions; or feast on the human intruders as you defend your colony by playing the carnivorous giant ants!
This package contains everything you need to play except six sided die!

Here’s what you get:
•A complete set of play tested rules, using easy-to-learn game mechanics.
•A partial sample turn with accompanying illustrations.
•2-D copies of all required game pieces for first-time players.
•Extensive diagrams and illustrations for “visual learners” to get playing fast!
•SEVEN unique scenarios for hours of gaming fun; play from two to six players!
•Comb binding for ease of play.
•Compatible with Flames of War basing.

162167.name: Stax
162167.description:
Stax is basically a Pachisi variant played by 2 players (each playing with 4 counters each of two colours which start in their respective "jails") or 4 players in partnership each playing one colour. The first player/team to get all 8 counters home wins.
Players alway throw two dice and must always move by exact count. It requires a six to move a counter out of jail.If a player's counter finishes on an opponent's counter then the opponents counter is returned to its jail. Once a player has got all of one colour home, he then requires a six and thereafter may move his other colour or partners colour on his colour's turn turn.
If two or more counters of the same colour land on the same square they form a stack. No opponent's counter may pass a stack. To break a stack a player must first land on the square immediately before that stack. He must then throw successive sixes equal to the number of stack counters plus one. If successful the stack counters are returned to their jail, otherwise the turn ends.
If a multicoloured stack is formed, this does not block movement, it may not attempt to break a stack and if landed on its counters are returned to their jails.

162168.name: Anduin (Issue 88 - Jul 2004)
162168.description:
Due to material that didn't fit the planned issue about pirates and sea-faring well, the material was split off and, together with reprints of articles previously published several years ago in X-Zine Anduin, this unexpected issue #88 was created.

The Buffy seasons are continued, the V:tM chronicle from previous issues draws to a close, and a generic scenario accompany a few articles about drow, a location (vineyard estate), GM advice, reviews, and fiction.

162169.name: Inquisitor
162169.description:
From publisher blurb:

All Heretics Shall Confess Their Crimes!

With the Inquisitor, a full 20-level class for Labyrinth Lord (and other old-school fantasy role-playing games), you'll ferret out the heretics and blasphemers. Whether by the sword or by your prayers, those who would defy the will of your god shall face justice!

162170.name: Metaphysician
162170.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bleeding hearts, and dry bones of the churchyard, and tears that burn as they fall!

With the Metaphysician, a full 20-level class for Labyrinth Lord (and other old-school fantasy role-playing games), you'll have all the secrets of theology and thaumaturgy to face the darkness. You've studied the very nature of the universe in hopes of defeating the darkness and whether it be wisdom or madness you've discovered, you're a welcome companion in any adventuring company!

162171.name: Villain Gazette Volume 1, Issue 12
162171.description:
From publisher blurb:


For Great Victory, Great Villains!

Sometimes, you just need stuff to beat up. Here, in the Villain Gazette, we provide a villain, their minions, and some cool new stuff for both sides to use. In this issue:

Vitress Veleno, the Bringer of Poison!
The Skinless Xombie Plaugue!
A selection of Mysterious Chi Abilities!




See the Villain's stats, learn their secrets, and prepare to depooy them on PCs in need of conflict. Includes the Redeemability Scale rating of the villlain (so you know if they can be salvaged), and Adventure Seeds for bringing the villain into YOUR campaign!

162172.name: Anduin (Issue 89 - Sep 2004) Piraterie & Seefahrt
162172.description:
Compared to the usual ratio of Anduin contributions not related to each issue's focal topic, #89 comes as a surprise: Almost the complete issue is devoted to pirates and adventures at sea.

This issue also contains a list of all reviews published from #69 up till now.

162173.name: The Wizard's Tower
162173.description:
From publisher blurb:

Designed by Arcknight Games, this multi-page PDF gives you 6 floors of a Wizard's Tower, including an entry floor, basement, laboratory, library, quarters and attic.

Each section was originally designed for high quality print on 11x17 maps, and the floors of the tower can be rearranged in any order you wish to suit the type of tower you wish to make. Your digital download includes the original 11x17 files, plus a series of 'ready to print' files in Letter format, a series of high resolution jpgs, a small set of .png objects formatted for use in VTT program, and as a special bonus - we're including a reworked set of maps specifically for use in VTT programs - a full 18" circular version of each floor, something that was impossible to produce on 11x17 pages, and an 'unfurnished' version of each floor as well.

This map pack contains:

3 multipage "print ready" PDFs in Letter Format, in standard 1" Grid Squares, 1" Hexes and Gridless.
High Resolution jpgs of each original map section, in 1" Grid Squares, 1" Hexes and Gridless.
A set of .png Objects, correctly sized and formatted for use in VTT programs such as Roll20.
A Special Bonus - A set of 18 x 18" Wizard's Tower maps specifically for use in VTT's, along with an 'unfurnished' copy of each map, something previously impossible when printing in 11x17 format.

162174.name: Fish Sticks
162174.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fish Sticks is the first book (of seven) in The Uncommon Commoners campaign series. In this semi-epic campaign, the uncommon commoners will fulfill their destiny. Or die trying. Or both—if their destiny is to die trying.

Bound by destiny and linked by a secret from the past, the uncommon commoners must face their first semi-great challenge, best explained by the following uncommon poem:

Welcome to Pisco, our village.
Which, I hope, you will not pillage.
Though the village smells please do not go!
I beg you to listen to our tale of woe!
Once we were happy and full of weal.
Now the place smells like a dead seal!
As for the cause of our pain
You do not need a giant brain
Nor the diviner’s art
To know that the fish do fart!
I am at my wit’s end!
Help us, or I’ll go around the bend!
That is what I have to say.
If you won’t help us, I bid you good day!

The Uncommon Commoners #1: Fish Sticks is a Pathfinder Role Playing Game compatible adventure. It is intended for a party of 1st-3rd level uncommon commoner characters (included in the adventure). While the adventure is written to be humorous and fairly light, it is also designed to be suitable for serious game play.

Here are some of the features of the adventure:

Detailed color maps for the adventure.
Fully developed NPCs, complete with detailed descriptions, backstories and motivations. And loot.
An actual plot. Really. In at least two senses of the term. Plus combat, of course.
Full statistics are included for all encounters—no need to look up monsters.
Pre-Generated uncommon commoners with backstories, catch phrases, special abilities and special feats.
New NPC classes (the magician and the wilds warrior).
New Traits & Feats (resilience, focused healer, heroic resilience, devoted healer, and doorman).
New rules for intelligent mounts.
New Spells (accompanying performer, amplify instrument, entourage, loud speak, and saltball).
New Magic Items & Equipment(boots of underwater walking, dancing sea bird, elixir of dancing, elixir of drunken dancing, necklace of saltballs, sexy tiara, salt bomb, bubble weed and Kelok crossbow).
86 pages of adventure (includes maps)!
Donk!

162175.name: The Dour Temple
162175.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dour Temple is the second book (of seven) in The Uncommon Commoners campaign series. In this semi-epic campaign, the uncommon commoners will fulfill their destiny. Or die trying. Or both—if their destiny is to die trying.

Bandits of wildly varying competence have begun accosting even old men and their old horses. Dour dwarf followers of the much-too-serious god Unjoi have taken over an abandoned temple of Baccarus, kicking out the semi-famous acting troupe of Caviolo & Son. A joyless druid has begun converting the joyous beasts of the woods into sober, hard-working dour beasts. It is up to the uncommon commoners to face the perils of the MandaTory Bandits, to endure the acting of Caviolo & Son, to rescue the beasts from dour dullness, and return joy to the Dour Temple. Can the uncommon commoners save the day? Or will they fall victims of an uncommon dourness?

The Uncommon Commoners #2: The Dour Temple is a Pathfinder Role Playing Game compatible adventure. It is intended for a party of 2nd-4th level uncommon commoner characters. While the adventure is written to be humorous and fairly light, it is also designed to be suitable for serious game play.

Here are some of the features of the adventure:

Detailed color maps.
Fully developed NPCs, complete with detailed descriptions, backstories and motivations. And loot.
Full statistics are included for all encounters—no need to look up monsters.
New deities (Baccarus, Na-A-Nee, and Unjoi)
New domains & subdomains (Dour Domain, Revel Domain, and Wine Subdomain).
New Spells (censor, create wine, inebriation, and sobriety).
New Magic Items & Equipment (dour bar, rock water, acorn vest, The Mace of Vicious Mercy, and Vest of Devouring Squirrels).
44 pages of adventure (includes maps)!
MandaTory Bandits!

162176.name: The Way of the Hoof
162176.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Way of the Hoof is the third book (of seven) in The Uncommon Commoners campaign series. In this semi-epic campaign, the uncommon commoners will fulfill their destiny. Or die trying. Or both—if their destiny is to die trying.

Centuries ago a faraway land was ravaged by endless war. Heeding the cries of the people, the Panda Guardians opened a spirit gate allowing refugees to flee to a new land. Once there, the people and animals of Panda Land (as it was named) lived in harmony under the benevolent guardianship of the Panda Monks. But, as always happens, evil entered the area and corrupted the heart of the greatest of the Panda Monks, Jaq-Blaq. He betrayed his fellows and installed himself as a warlord.

Despite his might, Jaq-Blaq ruled in fear: the owls prophesized that a donkey hero would free Panda Land. After Jaq-Blaq’s natural (non-donkey related) death, rule passed to his son. The son’s love of food and dislike of exercise earned him the name Fat Panda. While Jaq-Blaq ran the land with stern efficiency, Fat Panda’s sloth, greed and gluttony plunged the land into disarray. While the common folk made a few efforts to rebel against Fat Panda, his minions always managed to crush them. Thus did Fat Panda grow fat with confidence, despite the prophecy that donkey hoofs of justice would kick Fat Panda off his throne. Now the donkey of the prophecy journeys to Panda Land to save the people and to learn of his tragic past!

The Uncommon Commoners #3: The Way of the Hoof is a Pathfinder Role Playing Game compatible adventure. It is intended for a party of 3rd-6th level uncommon commoner characters. While the adventure is written to be humorous and fairly light, it is also designed to be suitable for serious game play.

Here are some of the features of the adventure:

Detailed color maps.
Fully developed NPCs, complete with detailed descriptions, backstories and motivations. And loot.
Full statistics are included for all encounters—no need to look up monsters.
New Feat (Create Spell Stone).
New Non Feats (Basket Hat, Cool Name, Dramatic Flair, Dying Monologue, and Fountains of Blood).
New Magic Items (Chow Line Hat, Donkey Shows of Throwing, Guide Stone, Gloves of Arrow Stabbing, Jade Earring, and Spell Stones).
New Spells (Ice Breaker, Wood Chopper, Stone Breaker, and Iron Breaker).
Hero Lab Portfolio (free download).
57 pages of adventure (includes maps)!
Fat Panda!

162177.name: The Red Masque
162177.description:
The Red Death is running rampant throughout the country, claiming countless lives. In an attempt to avoid this plague, Prince Prospero and a thousand of his closest friends have shut themselves inside the seven rooms of his castellated abbey. One night, the prince decides to throw a masquerade ball to keep his friends entertained. But while this ball is in full swing, a masked figure, of who had not been seen before, has started to make its way throughout the rooms of the abbey. Angered by this figure’s mask of a plague ridden corpse, the prince tried to kill the figure but was killed in the process. Now the prince’s nobles are hunting for the masked figure that at some point covered its mask with another. Now nobody knows who is who in this game of bluffing, deduction, and hand management.

In this game for 2 to 6 players, the game begins with the abbey of seven rooms being built and each player receiving one role card. The roles are kept hidden as they will be revealed during game play. Each player then selects one of the seven rooms where they will start the game. On each player's turn they will have a variety of actions that will allow them to trap, kill, or reveal other players, move throughout the abbey, or use a key to unlock a trap. They can perform these actions by using the cards that they draw. The goal of the game is to be the first collect five victory points and can do so by being a Noble alive at the end of the round or by not being trapped at the end of the round if playing as The Red Death.

Awards
2014 MicroGame Contest Best Theme
2014 MicroGame Contest People's Choice - 4th Place

162178.name: Wizard Valley
162178.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wizard Valley is the fourth book (of seven) in The Uncommon Commoners campaign series. In this semi-epic campaign, the uncommon commoners will fulfill their destiny. Or die trying. Or both—if their destiny is to die trying.

Many decades ago several families of humans grew weary of the endless wars plaguing their homelands and decided to create a new home far from the whims of kings and princes. Luckily, they found a hidden valley and established the appropriately named town of Hidden Valley. Being compassionate sorts, the humans invited other refugees, including a band of Halflings to join their community. Hidden Valley enjoyed peace and prosperity until the night the monsters arrived in the valley. While the Halflings were enslaved, history claims that all the humans were slaughtered.

Years after the slaughter, it is said, a powerful and enraged human wizard came the valley, doing terrible things to the monsters there and claiming the land as her own. While the wise have avoided the valley, rumors have emerged speaking of bizarre monsters, such as pumpkin gnolls and goblin chickens.

While the sensible would avoid such a valley, clues will lead the uncommon commoners to Wizard Valley to learn the past of Smartee, the smartest of the uncommon commoners. What weirdness and secrets are hidden in Wizard Valley? The uncommon commoners must find out…or die trying.

The Uncommon Commoners #4: Wizard Valley is a Pathfinder Role Playing Game compatible adventure. It is intended for a party of 4th-7th level uncommon commoner characters. While the adventure is written to be humorous and fairly light, it is also designed to be suitable for serious game play.

Here are some of the features of the adventure:

Detailed color maps.
Fully developed NPCs, complete with detailed descriptions, backstories and motivations. And loot.
Full statistics are included for all encounters—no need to look up monsters.
New Monsters (goblin chicken, ogre pigs, and the plant head template).
New Magic Items (Dunce Cap, Granny Smith’s Airy Apple Crisp, Plant Head Pie, Scary Robe, Sewing Kit of Mending, Roy the Wizard’s Hat, Staff Charge and Wizard’s Pipe).
New Spells (Plant Head and Think).
Hero Lab Portfolio (free download).
71 pages of adventure (includes maps)!
Apple Halflings!
Pumpkin Gnolls!

162179.description:
Hansa Teutonica: Britannia is an expansion for Hansa Teutonica that consists of a new map of Britannia and revised two-player rules.

The special permission in Carlisle, Cardiff and London means that you are allowed to do one of your normal placement or displacement actions in Wales and Scotland. You do not get an extra action.
162179.name: Hansa Teutonica: Britannia
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Good, The Board and The Expanded: Ep 46 “Expansions”
The Long View - Hansa Teutonica

162180.name: MALPRACTICE!
162180.description: MALPRACTICE! is an original card game filled with sabotage and surgery. Players act as doctors in an extremely poorly run hospital; every round a new patient is admitted, and players take turn treating him. The goal of the game is to heal the patient on your turn, while sabotaging your friend's treatments until they lose and get sued. The game is for 3 to 6 people, and takes approximately an hour per game. Rated 16 and up due to drug references.

162181.name: Anduin (Issue 90 - Jan 2005) Unknown Armies
162181.description:
Issue #90 contains the usual mix of articles, scenarios, fiction, and reviews. There's also a test of several self-published, free RPGs. The first German edition of Unknown Armies is introduced and receives a quick-start.

This issue was first published in landscape format (Querformat), but then layouted in the usual portrait format, too.

162182.name: Three Kings
162182.description:
Three Kings is a three-player chess puzzle game. Each player represents an "Alliance" of two of the three colors of chess pieces in the game (red, black and white). On each player's turn, they may move a piece prior to adding a new piece to the board.

In Three Kings, check and checkmate are not means to an end, as the object of the game is not to render checkmate, but to have the most points. When a King is put into check or is checkmated, the opposing color(s) involved score points. Because each player represents two colors of pieces, his or her score is mostly the sum of points scored by those two colors. However, each player also has a Hidden Agenda which may increase their score, and each player scores points for captures they make throughout the game.

162183.name: The Unspeakable Oath (Issue  24 - Jul 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Directives from A-Cell III: 'The World Needs Bad Men'
Message in a Bottle: Notes, TXTs, and a Two-Inch Article
Mysterious Manuscript: Fragments of the Gideon Bible
The Eye of Light and Darkness

162184.name: AFS Magazine (Issue 5 - Jun 2014)
162184.description:
AFS Magazine
Issue 5
June 2014

Cover art by Susan Seddon-Boulet.

162185.name: World of Ark Player's Primer
162185.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the forbidden and deadly Savage Shores of the Rhul to the cold steppe of the Khrun and from the Faerie Realms of Alvheim to the dark and mystical lands of Sorcere...Ark is filled with dozens of races. In this book you will be able to explore a full score of them, from the human Amarians to the beastly Minotaurs, these are only the beginning of the legendary races of Ark!

Also in this book you will find a synopsis of the Recent History of Ark, the Monetary System used in most of Ark, as well as an equipment list that goes with that system of coinage based on Silver instead of Gold. Everything you need to begin your ADND Adventures in the World of Ark.

162186.name: The Gilded Grimoire: Magic in the World of Ark
162186.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the World of Ark, the Science of Magic is a powerful force...fought for as a resource more precious than Gold. From the misty shrouded shores of the Realms of Alvheim to the Citadels of Sorcere, Magic-Users conspire with and against each other in a continuous cycle of magical strife and intrigue. Within this book, find out how they use their magic and what it means to be a Magic-User in Ark.

162187.name: Brutal: Big Bad Ball Busting Bloody Battles (Fourth Edition)
162187.description:
Publisher Blurb

This game is for serious players only! Hordes of Heart-Pounding, Heavy-Hitting, Hack-and-Slash action adventure await! This game is not for sissy players who don't want their characters to die. In a BRUTAL game, your characters get killed all the time. How long can your characters stay alive?

162188.name: Dino Breeder 2
162188.description:
User Summary

Second title of the Dino breeder games, that were only released in Japan.
Raise your own little dinosaur and have it fight against evil scientist. Inbetween treat it like a tamagotchi and feed, pet, play, heal it.

162189.name: Diesel Mice
162189.description:
From Introduction:

Diesel Mice is a game built on the FirstFable system by OneBookShelf, inc. Just like FirstFable, Diesel Mice is released under the Creative Commons Attribution Noncommercial Share Alike license. As such you are freely allowed to use, add to, and release your own modifications to this book.

Diesel Mice is designed to be simple enough that it can be used to introduce 8 to 12 year olds to the activity of roleplaying. Diesel Mice is designed with the intention of taking the FirstFable framework and building a setting reminiscent of many animated films (specifically, those dealing with mice living in a world just below the notice of the human world).

The rest of this book explains how to customize characters and how the game system works. It also provide advice for running the game, keeping the players engaged, and making sure everyone has fun. Finally, it finishes off with Raid On The Steel Mill, an introductory adventure. To run a game of Diesel Mice, you’ll need this book and a handful of six-sided dice (you can get these at many “big box” stores for very little money, or you can buy cool-looking colored dice from game stores — the love of multicolored dice starts early!)

For those of you familiar with FirstFable, there are a few changes from the original rules. The biggest change is that Diesel Mice does not make use of Character Books. There are character types included in this book in the Mouse Types chapter. Also, Special Things and Weaknesses have been reworked a little bit. The rules-as-written in FirstFable made you use Stars from Special Things and then optionally add a dice roll to them. Instead of that, in Diesel Mice you roll the dice, and then decide if you want to add Stars from the Special Thing. Also, Special Things provide Permission (a concept that has been discussed in the Fate community) meaning that Special Things may not mechanically influence a roll, but still give the ability to make the roll when a character without that Special Thing would not be given even a
chance. Using a Weakness recharges a Star on a Special Thing. Finally, there is an appendix on Advanced FirstFable system that is designed to be used as a next step for roleplayers who find FirstFable a little too simple.

162190.name: Witch Options
162190.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Fair is Foul, and Foul is Fair…”

Witch Options

With power born of dark and careful pacts with shadowy powers, witches learn the craft of their magic to achieve their goals, aligning it with the unlimited expression of the supernatural hex, their signature ability. Witch Options brings to light several magical methods and powers such as the cast circle (a fascinating focus for magical powers), and the broom and grimoire, to add to a witch’s versatility. Powerful feats, interesting items, and the template for the witch-themed hagborn add to a supplement packed with exciting options for your Pathfinder witch.

Wind up your charms; gather bell, book and candle; call your familiar and get Witch Options from 4 Winds Fantasy Gaming.

162191.description: Schau mal! Was ist anders? — literally "Look! What's different?" — challenges players to spot differences in a line of five cards after looking away for a moment. Has someone turned the light on in the house? Does the boy have his cap on backwards now? And did that child have a monkey on her head previously?! Whoever discovers the differences first keeps the card in question.
162191.name: Schau mal! Was ist anders?

162192.name: Nintama Rantarou GB: Eawase Challenge Puzzle
162192.description:
User Summary

In this Sokoban-style puzzle game, you can play different characters who have to solve several sliding puzzle games. Different from Sokoban, you can move rows of blocks at once. Try to solve the puzzle fast, as the remaining time will be your score.

162193.name: The Shadowdancer
162193.description:
From publisher blurb:

Civilized folk have always feared the night, barring themselves behind doors or comforting themselves with bonfires when the shadows grow long, rightfully wary of the creatures that prowl the darkness. Yet long ago, some learned that the best way to conquer an enemy is to embrace it. These were the first shadowdancers. Even today shadowdancers exist in the boundary between light and darkness, where they weave together the shadows to become half-seen artists of deception.

Prestige Class: Shadowdancer.
Build Classes: Rogue

Role: Shadowdancers adventure for a wide variety of reasons. Many adventuring parties find shadowdancers valuable members of their teams due to their incredible stealth and ability to surprise enemies with lightning quick attacks where they’re least expected. For this reason, their services are often sought out by those groups in need of scouts or spies.

162194.name: Battleborn
videogamehonor: 2015 Gamescom Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Visual Design of the Year Nominee
162194.description:
User Summary

Battleborn is a first-person battle arena with disparate heroes, from an immortal samurai to a minigun-wielding giant, all battling over the last star in the cosmos.

162195.name: Sonic the Hedgehog, an Unofficial RPG
162195.description:
Designer's Description:

Sonic the Hedgehog is about freedom from oppression and heroic antics of all kinds. It is also about the corrupting influence of power, embodied in the character of Dr. Robotnik/Eggman. It is about doing the right thing and dedication to ones’ beliefs – Sonic and pals all have power, but they use it to fight the villains of the game, and some have personal quests such as Knuckles’ protection of the Master Emerald.

162196.name: Derelict
162196.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Quick Mission for characters of levels 1-3, ready as stand-alone or for easy insertion into an existing campaign

A distress beacon has been traced to a battered starship drifting through an empty region of space. Were they attacked, or was this simple misfortune? Mysteriously, there is no sign that the crew or anyone else escaped.

162197.name: Forever Summer
162197.description:
from the website

Forever Summer is a role-playing game of children's adventure.
Evoking the likes of Goonies, Monster Squad, Eerie Indiana and Gravity Falls, Forever Summer drops you into the sleepy town of Oceanview for a long summer of adventure, mystery, thrills and excitement.

Behind every door lies a mystery, an adventure, or something scary!

Forever Summer features:

A simple system, suitable for children and beginners.
Details on Oceanview - a whole town of strange adventures!
Quick and easy play, suitable for fill in games and convention scenarios.

162198.name: Zombicide Survivor: Benny
162198.description:
Benny - The Children's Performer
"And now, boys and girls, let's give a big hand to Benny the Bear!"

Needing beer money, Benny answered an ad from a company specializing in children's parties. A star was born that day. a born thespian, Benny's repertoire included a bear, a knight, a giant, a talking zebra, and a friendly commando. He was at a children's party dressed as Captain Jack Action, the star of a popular children's TV show, when the zombies came. Benny's gun was a toy but like all great performers he improvised, fleeing the scene. He wears the costume to keep people from screwing with him and his acting skills make him much in demand amongst survivor groups...for awhile.

Benny is a promotional Survivor that was available to those that pledged extra during the Season 3 Kickstarter campaign. A Zombivor version is also included.

162199.name: Zombicide Survivor: Oksana
162199.description:
Oksana - The Stunt Woman
"I got two fractures, a concussion and a broken nose doing that stunt. It was awesome!"

Leaping from her roof onto a trampoline at the age of six, Oksana began her career as a stunt woman early. The broken arm set, and so did her resolve. Brushing off the minor nicks and abrasions that ensued over the years, Oksana found her way to Hollywood where her daredevil exploits quickly made her a star. No stunt was too dangerous, no risk too great, no height too high. Like all adrenaline junkies, Oksana felt that the price of fame was well worth the occasional fractured skull or hospital stay. The zombie outbreak has, if anything, made her even more reckless.

Oksana is a promotional Survivor that was available to those that pledged extra during the Season 3 Kickstarter campaign. A Zombivor version is also included.

162200.name: Zombicide Survivor: Patrick
162200.description:
Patrick - The Hipster
"God, I'd kill for a soy bean caramel peppermint latte right now."

Settling in a rapidly gentrifying neighborhood with 1.3 cafes per block and a vibrant arts scene, Patrick set about renovating his brownstone apartment. Wearing thrift-store shirts and stonewashed jeans, listening to the latest prog rock bands, and sipping lattes to his heart's content, Patrick lived an idyllic existence until the zombies came. He found inner reserves of strength he didn't know he had protecting his beloved neighborhood from the dead. It was a losing battle and soon Patrick was forced to leave, joining other survivors in their desperate struggle.

Patrick is a promotional Survivor that was available to those that pledged extra during the Season 3 Kickstarter campaign. A Zombivor version is also included.

162201.description:
This book has 4 board games and a crossword with some easy games used to explain Ancient Egypt to kids. The book also has punchable hard stock counters and even a die.

The four board games are:

Before the river floods. 2 players. Two farmers compete to bring all of their harvest to the granary before the river Nile floods. They must follow a circuit and can have encounters with gods disguised as animals that can help them or harm them.

Chariot race in Thebes. 2 players. Two teams of two chariots race for victory in a circuit full of bifurcations, barriers and even a herd of goats that moves really slow.

Finding Ra's crown. 1 player. Choose your adventure game in which you read the description for each chamber inside a pyramid and must choose your next action. Many lead to death, only one leads to victory.

Senet. 2 players. The original ancient Egypt Senet game.

There's also a crossword made with Egyptian hieroglyphic instead of latin letters.
162201.name: Egipte

162202.name: Red Dead Redemption - Outlaws to the End
videogamecompilation: Red Dead Redemption: Game of the Year Edition
162202.description:
User Summary

Outlaws to the End adds ten new achievements/trophies, six new missions, and four new playable classes.

162203.name: Red Dead Redemption - Legends and Killers
videogamecompilation: Red Dead Redemption: Game of the Year Edition
162203.description:
User Summary

Legends and Killers adds 9 New Multiplayer map locations, 8 New Multiplayer playable characters from Red Dead Revolver, 10 New Achievements/Trophies, ans a new projectile weapon: the Tomahawk, with corresponding Challenges for single player and multiplayer.

162204.name: Red Dead Redemption - Liars and Cheats
videogamecompilation: Red Dead Redemption: Game of the Year Edition
162204.description:
User Summary

Liars and Cheats adds Multiplayer Poker and Liar's Dice Games, Multiplayer horse races, new weapon explosive rifle with its own new single-player and multiplayer challenges, 7 New Gang Hideouts, 4 New Hunting Grounds, Posse Scoring and Leaderboards, 15 additional multiplayer characters from the Red Dead Redemption storyline, and New Achievements/Trophies.

162205.name: Red Dead Redemption - Myths and Mavericks
videogamecompilation: Red Dead Redemption: Game of the Year Edition
162205.description:
User Summary

Myths and Mavericks adds 8 new multiplayer characters, 10 new multiplayer locations, and 4 new strongholds. There are no new Trophies/Achievements, but stats accumulated within the new map locations do count towards existing challenges.

162206.name: Sunder the Stars
162206.description:
This started as a reworking of the Meka Tac - Giant Stompy Robots Edition rules into a starship combat game, along with the grafting of elements from a lifetime of pushing miniatures around a table while rolling dice.
That didn’t work as planned; the rules did the job, but not well enough to command anything more than a task force of a half-dozen ships per player. The ultimate goal was to handle the battle of fleets but still make the individual ship and how it was maneuvered matter. Some compromises were made, other things were simplified, and few items simply tossed out. The desire was to have a game that would entice new players to starship combat gaming and give an option for battles with larger numbers of ships to those who have fleets at the ready.

162207.name: Fire on the Water
162207.description:
Fire on the Waters is a naval warfare simulation portraying naval surface warfare in World War II. The simulation presents aspects
Each scenario set also includes a scenario generator to create scenarios typical for the time and place that the set covers.
The game presents these battles on a tactical, ship-to-ship level. The game is for two sides: one controlling the Allied ships and one
controlling the Axis ships. Ships are represented by cardboard counters or 1/6000 scale miniatures, with any 4' by 6' level surface serving
as a playing area.

162208.name: Fleet of Battle
162208.description:
Fleet of Battle was developed out of Field of Battle by Brent Oman (published by Piquet Inc.). The rules are for ancient naval warfare from Salamis to Actium. They are best for the Punic, Successor and Roman Civil Wars where the quinquireme (five) was the most common 'line of battle' ship. Fleet of Battle is intended for use with fleets of between six and 20 ships per player with an optimum of a dozen or so for an evening’s play. Larger battles can be fought without difficulty, but more than an evening should be set aside for such games.

There is no set ground scale or ship scale. The rules were devised for what felt right using 1:600 model ships. Fleets in classical times were very large, often several hundred ships strong, manned by tens of thousands.With this in mind it is suggested that historical scenarios should be fought using a ratio of one model to 10 - 20 ships.

If using 1:1200 scale models or smaller, use centimetres instead of inches.

162209.name: Starship Soldier
162209.description:
The rules are about small unit actions of a group or so, deployed planetside for VIP guarding, raiding, hostage rescue, arrest and capture and similar missions.

The rules are intended for use with 15mm scale models, or suitable counters of similar size.
Ground scale: 1 cm = 5 metres
Time scale: 1 game turn = 2-4 minutes
Figure scale: 1 figure = 1 soldier

162210.name: W-Zone
162210.description:
User Summary

W-Zone is a tank battle game where you defend your base against waves of enemies of increasing strength. Destroyed enemies drop coins which can be collected, and the funds used to upgrade your base, tank and weapons. Controls are keyboard WASD with mouse to aim and click to shoot.

162211.name: Robot Turtles Adventure Pack
162211.description: Take your Robot Turtles play to the next level with this limited edition Adventure Pack! Extend your young programmer’s skills with Frog Favorite Cards, designed to teach children to use and combine functions, a key coding concept. Bonus Jewel Tokens add a new programming challenge, as players learn to create increasingly complex code to collect them all. Put these new skills to work and take your Turtles on one of 10 new Adventure Quests, imaginative board setups each with a creative story line.

162212.name: SOMA
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2015 Global Game Awards Best Horror Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Global Game Awards Best Sci-fi Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Storytelling Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Visual Design of the Year Nominee
2016 SXSW Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
162212.description:
The game will take place on the PATHOS-2, an underwater remote research facility with machinery that begin to take human characteristics.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soma_%28video_game%29 Soma (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

162213.name: Escape Dead Island
162213.description:
User Summary

The game is set after the events of the original Dead Island. The player's character arrives on the island weeks after the initial virus outbreak that turned everyone into zombies. He and his friends are tasked with finding out what happened.

162214.name: Dead Island: Epidemic
162214.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN BETA




This game is in Beta and has not been fully released yet.




The World's First ZOMBA! Dead Island: Epidemic is a fast-paced action game where players will duke it out over supply points, using an arsenal of crafted weaponry, a bevy of devastating powers, and good old-fashioned teamwork.

Source: The Developer Website.

162215.name: Dead Island 2
162215.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN DEVELOPMENT




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it, nor add new releases.




It is more vibrant and light-hearted (yet violent) than its predecessors.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dead Island 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

162216.name: Black Gold Online
162216.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




March into the volatile land of Montel, a continent torn apart by two distinct factions of war. A precarious détente exists between the steam-powered Kingdom of Isenhorst and the magically enriched Erlandir Union. The two sides have endured countless invasions, and the world has found an uneasy peace on the brink of collapse,
as each belligerent alignment seeks total domination over the increasingly more valuable Black Gold.

Source: The Developer Website.

162217.description:
This expansion was available at the SPIEL 12 and from publisher website and consists of:

- 34 Wooden pieces (24 cowboys, 6 red Indians, 4 orange Indians)
162217.name: Western Town: Meeple Pack

162218.name: Muramasa Rebirth - Genroku Legends: Fishy Tales of the Nekomata
162218.description:
User Summary

Fishy Tales of the Nekomata downloadable episode puts players in control of a girl named Okoi, who is possessed by Miike, a nekomata. Okoi avenges the death of her brother using her cat-like claws and demon powers to summon "hordes of cat allies" to battle alongside her.

162219.name: Muramasa Rebirth - Genroku Legends: A Cause to Daikon For
162219.description:
User Summary

You play as the downtrodden farmer Gonbe, who has taken it upon himself to ask the powers that be to re-think the taxes that are driving his village to the brink of ruin. With the spirit of his deceased wife Otae and some of his fellow farmers by his side, Gonbe sets off to fight for nothing less than the very survival of everyone he knows and cares about! Wielding only a hoe, sickle, and a simple bamboo spear

162220.name: Muramasa Rebirth - Genroku Legends: A Spirited Seven Nights' Haunting
162220.description:
User Summary

Players assume the role of Arashimaru, a ninja who is being hunted by his former clan. Worse yet, while fighting off an attack, he inadvertently desecrates the shrine of a powerful spirit who curses him; giving him only seven days left to live.

162222.name: Tokyo Twilight Ghost Hunters
162222.description:
User Summary

A newly transferred high school student along with another student in Shinjuku are attacked by an evil spirit. Thankfully, a pair of intrepid ghost hunters intervene just in time. While talking to others, you’ll be prompted to choose from emotions like love, sadness, or anger or one of your five senses such as sight, sense, smell, etc to convey your feelings.

162223.name: Mood X
162223.description:
Mood X is a storytelling and lateral thinking game in which your playmates' personality is part of the game.

The game is divided into turns, and on each turn a different player acts as the protagonist of a short story. A clever mechanism helps the other players to generate a range of stories in little time.
