When the story is over, each player attempts to deduce and guess the mood of the protagonist player: Secretly, players choose a specific mood on their mood wheels, then everybody reveals their choice. Points are scored depending on how close your choice is to the protagonist's chosen mood. The protagonist-player scores victory points depending on how close the other players get to his chosen mood.

When everybody has scored points, the role of the protagonist passes clockwise, and a new turn starts. The first player to reach 24 victory points wins.

162224.description:
Promo Set is available at a variety of events, exhibitions and competitions. The set contains a new character, new location and new subject.

Tramp.
Grotto.
Poker.

The expansion is a part of regular polish edition of base game.
boardgameversion: Tajemnicze Domostwo: Lost letter Promo Set
162224.name: Tajemnicze Domostwo: Lost letter Promo Set

162225.description:
The Kickstarter Limited Exclusive Mini-Expansion is contained in the box of the Deluxe edition for Kickstarter backers, but may also be available separately in the future. From the Kickstarter page,

Kickstarter Limited Exclusive - VERY limited quantity printed. Will never enter regular distribution channels but may become available via contests, conventions, and/or the BGG store.

It introduces 11 cards not found in the Base edition:

Giant Snake (Dire Enemy)
Basilisk (Dire Enemy)
Fire Elemental (Epic Foe)
Overlord (Epic Foe)
Baal's Bait (Artifact)
Gavel of Gamelyn (Artifact)
Necromancer (Hero)
Assassin (Hero)
Avenger (Legendary Hero #1)
Revenant (Legendary Hero #2)
Guardian (Legendary Hero #3)
162225.name: Tiny Epic Defenders: Kickstarter Mini-Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 31 - Tiny Epic Defenders

162226.description: Kickstarter exclusive that includes 10 dual treatment cards
162226.name: Gothic Doctor: Dual Treatment Kickstarter Exclusive Cards

162228.description:
Money makes the world go round. It also helps secret agents pay their rent.

In [redacted]: Mercenaries, a whole new level of spycraft is necessary, not for the glory of the revolution or to defend fast food and reality TV, but to end your career with a nice chunk of change. With a variety of conflicting missions, players must use the skills they picked up during the base game of [redacted] to work together (or not) and complete assignments for their shadowy employers.

Changing loyalties, shifting objectives, conflicting assignments. Nothing ever stays the same, and players must balance short-term gain and long-term strategy to win, in this advanced expansion to [redacted].
162228.name: [redacted]: Mercenaries

162229.name: Ambeth: Animes verzaubern
162229.description:
Publisher blurb:
Ambeth ist ein Rollenspiel, in dem man in die Rolle von Internats- Zauberlehrlingen schlüpft und damit beginnt seine Zauberkünste zu verbessern.

Nach und nach erreicht man die 10. Klasse des Internats und darf sich von da an Zauberer nennen.

Ambeth ist eine fiktive Welt, die unserer Welt nicht ganz unähnlich ist, nur etwas futuristischer und magischer.

From the back of the core book:
Du bist ein Zauberlehrling in einer Welt, die unserer Erde gleicht, jedoch etwas futuristischer ist. Und mit der Ausnahme, dass dort keine Menschen leben. Ja, genau. Du bist kein Mensch. Du bist ein Anime. Gemeinsam mit deinen Freunden musst du die 10. Stufe zum Magier erreichen.
Mach dich also gefasst auf jede Menge Spaß und auf das Bewältigen von normalen bis total verrückten Aufgaben und Abenteuern.
Die Welt von Ambeth erwartet dich. Bist du bereit für Anime?

TRANSLATION (Google with some user emendations)
Publisher blurb:
Ambeth is a role playing game where you take on the role of sorcerer's apprentices at a boarding school and begin to improve your magic.

Gradually we reach the 10th grade of the boarding school and may be called from then on wizards.

Ambeth is a fictional world that is not unlike our world, just more futuristic and magical.

From the back of the core book:
You're a sorcerer's apprentice in a world that resembles our earth, but is somewhat futuristic. And with the exception that there are no humas. Yes, exactly. You are not a human. You are an Anime. Together with your friends you need to reach Level 10 as a Mage.
Make yourself prepared for lots of fun and the ability to handle normal to totally crazy tasks and adventures.
The world of Ambeth awaits you. Are you ready for anime?

162230.name: Egg Drop
162230.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Extended Mission for characters of levels 2-3

Chiraktis smugglers have been shipping their eggs to hidden compounds on lightly colonized worlds, using the rapidly maturing young to dominate local governments, eventually overruling them be sheer numbers. Putting a stop to this practice involves following a tangled thread that may lead to a dangerous expansionist operation run by the deadly insect race.

162231.name: A Test of Strength
162231.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Quick Mission for characters of levels 5-7, ready for easy insertion into an existing campaign

A distress call quickly turns to a general alarm as one of the galaxy's most advanced research stations is under attack! The unknown alien threat is cutting a swath of destruction through the base's defenders--can your team turn the tide before there are no survivors?

162232.name: Blessed are the Peacemakers
162232.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Extended Mission for characters of levels 9-11

Shadows of suspicion have fallen across a diplomatic conference that was to herald an era of peace and unity between the once-warring Erwani and Omul races. Fears of sabotage and treason line the elegant halls, while a nightmarish adversary waits in the darkness.

162233.name: Unnatural Selection
162233.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Extended Mission for characters of levels 6-8

A series of mysterious incidents have occurred in relatively obscure regions of space, including an attack by pirates on a starship graveyard. The UG has grown concerned over these events, and it is up to you to investigate them and put an end to any lurking threats.

162234.name: Souls of Steel
162234.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Quick Mission for characters of levels 10-12

A bloody border war leads to a stunning victory for the ISU, but one remaining task must be completed by UG special forces--securing the command and control center abandoned by the retreating enemy. Within its crumbling halls, deadly machines still carry out their master's final orders.

162235.name: Fugitives
162235.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Extended Mission for characters of levels 4-6

Several deadly fugitives have escaped from a prison ship and made their way to the crumbling cities of a world ruled by poverty and violence. You must apprehend all of them before they can escape or carry out their plans.

162236.name: The Tarball Run
162236.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Extensive Mission for characters of levels 8-9

Intel indicates that a long-time enemy of the Union Guard is going to enter the popular starship race known as the Tarball Run, though he will be disguised and registered under an alias. Your team will enter the race undercover, posing as racers, and attempt to track down this notorious criminal. Be prepared to compete in the intense starship race to defeat your target, an aggressive and deadly pilot with a kill sheet that includes UG agents!

In this mission, players will explore the Tarball Race Arena and interact with various racing teams, gathering information and gossip that will not only help them track down the criminal they seek, but will help them learn about other racing teams and how to survive or defeat them in the upcoming race. Each of the major racing teams uses different tactics and starships, so the players will need to gather as much intel as they can before they face them in the competition. Players will work together on board their starship to get the most out of their craft, taking on roles such as Science Officer, Engineer, Communications Officer, Pilot, and Commander. Using their combined skills and the advantages each crew role provides, the players will manage their starship in battle against other racers until the final showdown, where they must defeat the outlaw not only in a dogfight, but in combat aboard his ship!

162237.name: Hostages of Helios
162237.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Quick Mission for characters of levels 5-7

Hostages have been captured aboard an orbital solar power station, and now the enemy intends to use the station itself as a weapon! You must free the hostages and prevent their captors from destroying the city below!

162238.name: The Seeds of Chaos
162238.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Quick Mission for characters of levels 1-3, ready as stand-alone or for easy insertion into an existing campaign

All of the robots in the Tri-Sun Mall have malfunctioned and have gone totally haywire! You and your team must stop the dangerous robots and prevent them from destroying the shopping center. Investigate and uncover who orchestrated the rampage, how they did it, and why!

Features:

An exciting mission that puts characters up against a wide variety of robots with unique attacks, behaviors, and weaknesses.
Combat, dialogue, and vehicle encounters, plus hacking challenges
An open-ended scenario with many creative encounter options to keep players appropriately challenged
A fun low-level mission that introduces a situation and an enemy that can easily become a persistent threat in future missions
Extra artwork and flavor-text sidebars
For 1st to 3rd level characters

162239.name: Novaburn Character Pack
162239.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Novaburn Character Pack includes 7 new, fully designed sample characters ready for quick play for players, or for Mission Controllers looking for detailed NPC's. Each character has a unique backstory, equipment, skills and talents that are balanced with the other sample characters to provide a well-rounded team, capable of dealing with any scenario. Also included are suggestions for each character's role on a starship and three sample starships for quick battle to challenge player teamwork. A beginning level mission, The Novaburn Raid (levels 1-3), details the scenario and NPC's that will test players in squad combat, and the provided apartment map and character icons add to the visual excitement of the mission.

162240.name: Orientation Guide
162240.description:
From publisher blurb:

Catch a glimpse of the Solar Echoes universe with the free Orientation Guide! Inside are details about the setting and a quick example of the fast-paced combat system.

In the setting info, learn about the Inter-Stellar Union, the Union Guard, and your role as a Union Guard agent. Also included is historical info about the part of the galaxy you are in, some history about the seven races, and a hint at what is to come. In the combat tutorial, two characters face off against a security drone, trying different moves and attacks to defeat it over the course of 3 rounds, which are detailed with maps for each round, showing character movements and positions.

162241.name: Xenos NPC Pirate Pack
162241.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Xenos NPC Pirate Pack includes 8 new, fully detailed sample characters ready for battle! Mission Controllers looking for detailed NPC's will find that each character has a unique backstory, equipment, skills and talents that are balanced with the other sample characters to provide a well-rounded team ready to challenge players. Also included are suggestions for each character's role on a starship and three sample starships ready for space combat. A variety of pirate-encounter scenarios are provided to integrate these NPC's into your Solar Echoes campaign. The NPC's are detailed at 4th and 5th levels, but each pirate can easily be quickly adjusted to fit any level campaign scenario.

162242.name: Explorer's Pack
162242.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Explorer's Pack includes 4 new, detailed planets, alien lifeforms, and mission scenarios! Adventure lies among the stars, as your team of UG agents investigates dangers and mysteries on distant worlds. The Explorer's Pack contains all you need to create missions on several new planets, including scientific data, historical information, biological examples, and starter mission ideas. Featuring full color planetary artwork by Matthew Hannum and b&w alien lifeform sketches by Andy Mitchell.

162243.name: Overnight Elite Pack
162243.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Overnight Elite Pack includes details about how to level characters quickly and easily for play at higher levels. This quick-leveling system is recommended for player use with the permission of their Mission Controller. MC's are advised to use this system to make it easier to run higher-level missions without having to adjust the contents of the mission to fit lower level characters. This system is also ideal for MC's seeking to produce quick NPC challenges for players.

162244.name: Coopopoly
162244.description: Coopopoly is a board game with a baseball/Cooperstown theme. Choose a player piece and start playing...as you buy, sell, and trade The National Baseball Hall of Fame, Farmers' Museum, Otesaga Hotel and all of your favorite businesses and museums in Cooperstown, NY! It's a new addition to complete every baseball collection and the perfect gift for any baseball fan, Cooperstown entusiast, and board game lover. Designed by elementary teacher this game can also encourage math skills for young children!

162245.name: Western Pulp
rpgseries: Worlds of Pulp Random Event Tables
162245.description:
From publisher blurb:


Yee Hah! Keep your western RPGs fresh with this generator

Add exciting content to your Western Pulp Campaign.

One of the biggest hardships most Game Masters have attempting to run western campaigns, is that there does not seem to be enough story possibilities to keep a game alive and flourishing—nonsense. These tables are provided to offer endless western adventure hooks.

Pull on your boots and strap on you shooting irons. There is going to be high adventure in big country tonight!

8 pages of tables and event hooks offer over 90,000 thousand possibilities for your game. Add your personal touch and the possibilities become endless. Our tables are designed to give quick and exciting possibilities to any western campaign while preserving an appropriate clasic western book feel.

All you need 2d6
Descriptions are kept generic

162246.name: The Letter B
162246.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever wonder what a balk is? Where the word "bugbear" comes from? Or just what goes into making buttered ale?

Alphabet Soup is a comprehensive guide to words commonly (and uncommonly) found in games or used by gamers. It provides quick, easy definitions in lexicon form: gaming terms, definitions, historical context, mythological terms. It even gives gamemasters advice on how they can use them in their games. It works like an encyclopedia of random bits, only these random bits are things I think are interesting for gamemasters.

Flip it open randomly to discover that a Bridewell Keeper is a flavorful term for a warden, then introduce one into your games. The letter B covers everything from Bord to Buzman; from Brevat Rank to a rant about Game Balance.

162247.name: Moon Valley
162247.description:
From publisher blurb:

After years of The Chimera’s experiments, some have begun to migrate to wreak more havoc than usual. People in affected areas have abandoned their homes and livelihoods. In many cases, the creations stripped the land around them of edible plants and game, then moved in to attack the residents. The PCs must defend Moon Valley from their encroachment, discovering the reasons for these new attacks if they can.
Moon Valley is a 1-Sheet style scenario that focuses on the adventures of a band of Witchmarked heroes in the Accursed game setting. The adventure may be played as a standalone, or it may be used with the Plot Point Campaign included in Accursed. The adventure features brief scene descriptionss, with necessary game mechanics and opportunity for tasks that can be resolved in a variety of ways.

Accursed provides additional details about the setting used in this scenario, and is required to fully make use of the game mechanics presented. Savage Worlds and the Savage Worlds Horror Companion are also required.

This PDF uses layers for ease of printing.

162248.name: Thrown Bones: Fantasy RPG Reward Deck
162248.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players work hard for their XP. Go ahead and throw 'em a bone!

Thrown Bones is a collection of small to medium rewards a game master can bestow upon players for exeptional gameplay, or just pulling off something clever or hilarious.

Rewards range from 5% bonuses to specific dice rolls to game changers like the Wand of Cartographic Potential that allows a player to "pencil in" a door on the game map.

Cards are inspired by and feature elements from the "Random Wizard" web comic. Cards also feature an optional experience point value that can be chosen over the given card effect or bonus.

Thrown Bones features 30 original cards, in addition to duplicates of cards that are used in "mini games".

162249.name: Me Booty!
162249.description:
A ship full of scallywags and a hold full of loot... it’s time to divvy up the booty. Keep an eye on the crew though, because everyone knows pirates be cheaters! Try to keep the best loot for yourself while giving the worst to your mates! Once all pirates have five treasures, the pirate with the most valuable loot wins.

Me Booty! is a card game for 3 to 6 scallywags. On your turn you must decide to take treasure for yourself, give it to another pirate, or use some sneaky back-stabbing to sabotage your mates.

162250.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – The Collective Month 1 Organized Play Borg Cube and tokens
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
162250.description:
Comes with the following for use with the "First Contact" scenario as a part of Month 1 of "The Collective" organized play tournaments:

1 Borg Cube (ship) Token with unique stats (6/0/8/8)
8 Resistance Tokens
4 Hidden Movement Tokens

162251.name: Deep Carbon Observatory
rpghonor: 2014 Indie RPG Awards Best Production Runner-Up
2014 Indie RPG Awards Best Support Winner
2014 Indie Supplement of the Year Winner
162251.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep Carbon Observatory is an adventure for Dungeons and Dragons.

The adventure takes players from a town devastated by an unexpected flood, through a drowned land where nature is turned upside down and desperate families cling to the roofs of their ruined homes, hiding from the monstrous products of a disordered world, through the strange tomb of an ancient race, to a profundal zone, hidden for millennia and now exposed, and finally to the Observatory itself, an eerie abandoned treasure palace, where they will encounter a pale and unexpected terror which will seek to claim their lives.

The adventure is suitable for a lucky mid-range party, a stupid high-level party or an exceedingly clever low level party. It is difficult, with a meaningful possibility of character death. Should you find them, and defeat their guardians, the treasures of an ancient culture will be yours.

At the final point of the Observatory is a glimpse of another world.

Deep Carbon Observatory is about 90 pages long, 20,000 words with four maps and extensive artwork by Scrap Princess.

Stats are minimal and given for LOTFP but should be easily transferable into any simple D&D system.

162252.name: Series Pitch: Gallows' End
162252.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the far-off forest moon of Gallows' End, enforcing Federal law is a damn sight harder than it is among the Central Planets. As a Star Marshal, you'll have to decide whether to stand with the Law right or wrong, or roll with the punches and keep the locals on your side. Either way, weaving a safe path through the tapestry of local loyalties is a hard task for anyone, especially when they have a duty to more than their kin.

Decide what's important to you and chart a course by it when you find yourself at Gallows' End!

Written in the format of a Series Pitch for Robin D. Laws' OGL DramaSystem, this short and punchy PDF is a perfect springboard for campaigns using any number of systems. Even better, all our Series Pitches are based on adventures and campaigns played here at Morningstar HQ, so you know they work.

162253.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 61 - Jun 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Magi of the Age of the Strife
162253.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex or faction within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people. Full-color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other location are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

House Tharbon
Magi Ways Magic
Magi of the Age of Strife
Dress of the Centaurs

162254.name: Feats of Nature
162254.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mythic Minis: Feats of Nature brings you 10 mythic feats for masters of the wild, be they harmless hermits or heartless hunters, from feats to enhance wild shaping like Shaping Focus and Wild Speech to feats to enhance your versatility with nature like Greater Wild Empathy and Vermin Heart!

162255.name: PACS Expansion II: Vehicular Voyages
162255.description:
From publisher blurb:

Travel the world in style using new Vehicle Loot cards!

Are you looking to find adventure on the high seas? Do daring exploits atop a careening wagon excite you? Have you ever wanted to ride a chariot into battle?

From ships to wagons and everything in between, this expansion provides your game with tools to sate your wanderlust. Included are 18 cards that add Vehicle Loot cards to PACS as well as additional Heroes and Foes that specialize in vehicular adventuring.

Please note that this is an expansion for PACS (Pocket Adventures Card System). You will need a base set of PACS to play the game.

162256.name: PACS Expansion I: Heroic Heritages
162256.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth to your Hero or Foes with Races and Professions!

If you've ever wanted more options for your PACS Heroes or Foes, this expansion is for you! Included are 18 cards that allow you to modify any Hero or Foe for additional flavor and power. Now when you say your Ranger is an Elf, you'll gain some Elven bonuses to your character. Dungeon Masters can use the cards to modify Foes similarly.

Please note that this is an expansion for PACS (Pocket Adventures Card System). You will need a base set of PACS to play the game.

162257.name: Alchemist’s Shop
162257.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a full-color, 16 x 10 inch battlemap of an Alchemist’s Shop.

“Come in, come in. What kind of potion are you seeking today? My new Teslamuter can create any potion your heart desires.”

DramaScape dares you to try the potions in our Alchemist’s Shop! Will it help, do nothing, or harm the character? Only the Game Master knows!

Alchemist’s Shop is an internal view map of a small shop or small laboratory for alchemical research. This product includes a 360-degree panoramic view from the center of the shop.

Alchemist’s Shop is intended for use in modern games. Boilers and a machine are displayed in the map therefore electricity is a minimum requirement. The style of the shop would fit a steampunk or teslapunk game easily.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

The Teslamuter: An alchemist became quite popular in town by selling potions he created with his Teslamuter. The potions he has created with electricity give a jolt to the people that imbibe them and make them full of energy. But when the potion runs out, the imbiber becomes lethargic until he can get another dose. This made people into addicts of the alchemist’s potions.

Then people started dropping dead of heart attacks. Worse a rash of grave robbing incidents followed targeting the victims.

The Player Characters can get involved in several ways. One way is that one of the characters or their allies becomes addicted to the potions. They should have a highly positive effect such as increased speed, better initiative, more actions, etc. but the negative effect should be something like fatigue, or debilitating penalties reverse of the positive effect once the potion runs out. When the imbiber has a heart attack and either dies or is left holding on for dear life, the group goes to the alchemist for either revenge or a cure to the addiction.

Or the player characters can get involved by being investigators into the mysterious glut of heart attack deaths and graveyard robbery perhaps even catching the alchemist in the act of robbing a grave. In this scenario, the alchemist is a bit better prepared and has a surprise for the them; zombies with a replacement heart that pumps his Teslamuter solution to keep the body going. Those who were addicted in life have a greater affinity for the substance in death forcing him to target their bodies specifically rather than just any old corpse.

162258.name: Office
162258.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 16 x 30 inch Battlemap of an Office, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“It’s a simple job, break into the boss’s office and extract all the data on his PC with this external hard drive.”

Time to punch the clock for work in DramaScape’s Office! Work includes extraction of data, personnel, and packages with payment on delivery of the goods.

Office is an internal view map of an office floor in a building.

Office is intended for modern settings. It also might work in near future science fiction settings such as cyberpunk although the old-style monitors are a bit of a stretch. The really cheap company simply refuses to invest in new monitors in that case, forcing their employees to work with outdated equipment. It may also be an interesting location for a horror game, such as barricading the stairway door from zombies as the Player Characters try to survive for as long as possible on the top floor of the building.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

Payback: The office boss recently fired an employee from his office job. The employee knows he saw the boss doing things on his personal computer (PC) that are not in the company’s interests. He needs a copy of all the information on the PC. He intends to use the information to blackmail his boss to either get his job back or barring that to humiliate him and get him fired. And perhaps both.

He hires the Player Characters to break into the office at night and use an external hard drive to download all the information on his boss’s PC. The Player Characters must bypass the locked front door and the lone security guard on watch. The boss’s PC is protected by passwords and other firewalls requiring the Player Characters to hack into the PC to get all the information out of it. While the information is being downloaded into the external hard drive, a squad of security guards suddenly arrives from the stairs and elevator and tells the group to freeze. Was there an alarm built into the PC itself? These security guards are wearing a completely different uniform than the security guard that was on watch. If they want to get the information out of there, they’ll have to fight off the security guards while the download completes!

162259.name: Mining Colony
162259.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 2 level, Black and White Blueprint of an Outer Space Mining Colony. It is 72 inches by 60 inches at its widest point.

The Product comes with the Hex, Square and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps.

“The trick is to make the people look where you want them to look. We are just a normal mining operation after all officially.”

Mining Colony is a hand-drawn, black and white, blueprint style map. The product includes a subterranean mining level and a ground level base on the planet’s surface. Each individual area in the spacecraft is labeled and includes hand-drawn objects signifying all of the objects in the area.

Mining Colony is designed for use as a standalone map or with the Space Station blueprint map. The colony has enough bedrooms for 21 colonists.

Mining Colony is intended for use in science fiction games.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

Pilfering from History: The mining company chose to excavate at exactly the right spot. Not only did they find rich veins of ore, but also strange and bizarre alien artifacts. Rather than register them with the government of the solar system, they decided to make molds of the alien artifacts, hollow out the cores of some of their mineral cubes, and replace them with the alien artifacts in molds. They sent these specific cores to their corporate headquarters for study of the alien artifacts at their research labs. The expansion of the mining colony added colonists who work to make the colony self-sufficient.

Pirates often attack the transport shuttle but the fighters have fended them off up to now. This time, a single alien fighter attacked the transport shuttle and managed to disable one of the fighters before a lucky shot by his wingman destroyed the alien ship. The mining company sent home for help from their corporate headquarters immediately.

The Player Characters are mercenaries bringing a new fighter with them to the mining colony. As soon as they land in the hangar, people inside the facility panic. Some sort of alien carrier has appeared. The fighter on the landing strip is bombed and most of the personnel panic and flee to the subterranean level via the elevator. The alien carrier lands on the north side of the strip and sends an organic tube to the walls of the transport ship and hangar. An acidic ichor breaches the metal walls and alien soldiers pour into the shuttle and mining facility. The nearly extinct alien race intends on getting their artifacts back with only the group and a few brave men of the mining colony standing in their way.

162260.name: Alternate Class Abilities
162260.description:
From publisher blurb:

“In a nondescript dwelling, down a dusty hallway, past rooms of unclear purpose, there is a door... a door that looks like many others, except for the ancient maroon tint of the aged wood, and, of course, the glowing runes emblazoned on the stones that make up the door-frame. Should you know its purpose, should you know the correct sequence to touch those runes, you might gain entry to a Storeroom of wonders, shelves and bins and racks beyond counting. Place your torch in the rusty sconce, and enter...”

The Purple Storeroom is a series of tightly-focused supplements that cover topics that do not fit into our larger offerings. They are the pieces that just don’t fit anywhere else or they are the little things we work on to take a break from bigger projects like Purple Mountain, Legendary Treasures, or Lands of Porphyra. They have been stored here for safe keeping.

We've all had it happen. You want to create a specific type of character but to get the abilities you want you are forced to level dip to gain what you want. In the meantime some other abilities you possess in your primary class are never used. There needs to be a better way. This product came about from my discussions with Patricia Willenborg about the scarcity of the poison use class ability.

How do alternate class abilities work?

To take an alternate class ability, you must give up a class ability of the same level when you level up or retrain.
Bonus feats and divine auras are not considered class abilities for the purpose of these rules.
Spellcasters may give up a level of spellcasting progression to gain alternate class abilities if they wish.
All substitutions made are subject to GM’s approval.

162261.name: The Legend of Korra
162261.description:
User Summary

he Legend of Korra is the continuation of the American animated series Avatar: The Last Airbender. Years after Aang’s story has ended, the next Avatar, Korra emerges to fulfill her legendary role. Just as in the show, Korra can manipulate all four elements. Each of these elements, (fire, earth, water, wind) is suited for a particular type of combat.

162262.name: War Thunder: Ground Forces
162262.description:
User Summary

War Thunder: Ground Forces is an expansion that contains all of the features found in the 1.41 version of the game as well 350 different planes, squadron battles, more than 150 multiplayer missions, and many other improvements.

162263.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In some of the best versions of reality, the Egyptians discover America, the industrial revolution happens early, and eventually robots take over. In others, the Renaissance produces a plutocracy, which leads to a utopia — or perhaps to anarchy; it's all in the subtle details. As a time-traveler, you've seen it all, and it all has its place. What's important is who's in control in the long run when time travel is invented. With other time-travelers mucking with things for their own reasons, your course is clear: you will tamper with history as much as is needed, stepping on however many butterflies it takes, to get a perfect world under your own benign rule.

In Temporum, the board shows the possible paths history can take and the actual path it currently takes. On your turn, you can change history, travel through time, and visit a point in history. You draw cards, play some of them for money and abilities, and score some of them to advance your power through history. Having more power in a time period gives you abilities, but your goal is to have all of your power in the last time period, the time from which you come.
boardgameversion: English first edition (second printing w/ larger arrows)
162263.name: Temporum
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 020 – Reasons to Sell a Game
Ep. 12 – Stephen Bounocore and Nonsensical Secret Santa | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 51 -- The Amplification of Luck and Chaos
Episode 81-- Gen Con 2014 Top 11 to Try and Top 11 to Buy with special gues W. Eric Martin from BGG News

162264.name: Pathways (Issue 40 - Jul 2014)
rpgissuearticle: "Choose Your Own Adventure" - Using Plot Outlines to Transform Your Game
The Path Less Traveled #6: All the Cool Toys

162265.name: Under Night In-Birth
162265.description:
User Summary

Under Night In-Birth Exe:Late features arcade style combat with a system that is easy to pick up but difficult to master.

162266.name: Exotic Liquors
162266.description:
From publisher blurb:

“In a nondescript dwelling, down a dusty hallway, past rooms of unclear purpose, there is a door... a door that looks like many others, except for the ancient maroon tint of the aged wood, and, of course, the glowing runes emblazoned on the stones that make up the door-frame. Should you know its purpose, should you know the correct sequence to touch those runes, you might gain entry to a Storeroom of wonders, shelves and bins and racks beyond counting. Place your torch in the rusty sconce, and enter...”

The Purple Storeroom is a series of tightly-focused supplements that cover topics that do not fit into our larger offerings. They are the pieces that just don’t fit anywhere else or they are the little things we work on to take a break from bigger projects like Purple Mountain, Legendary Treasures, or Lands of Porphyra. They have been stored here for safe keeping.

Exotic Liquors covers a thirteen intoxicants for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game that use the addiction rules from the Gamemastery Guide by Paizo Publishing including Ratfolk 'Rat Poison', Erkunae Chaos-Cordial, and whiskeys from the Fenian Triarchy.

162267.name: Gels
162267.description:
From publisher blurb:

“In a nondescript dwelling, down a dusty hallway, past rooms of unclear purpose, there is a door... a door that looks like many others, except for the ancient maroon tint of the aged wood, and, of course, the glowing runes emblazoned on the stones that make up the door-frame. Should you know its purpose, should you know the correct sequence to touch those runes, you might gain entry to a Storeroom of wonders, shelves and bins and racks beyond counting. Place your torch in the rusty sconce, and enter...”

The Purple Storeroom is a series of tightly-focused supplements that cover topics that do not fit into our larger offerings. They are the pieces that just don’t fit anywhere else or they are the little things we work on to take a break from bigger projects like Purple Mountain, Legendary Treasures, or Lands of Porphyra. They have been stored here for safe keeping.

Gels introduces a trio of engineered lifeforms. A tripled of oozes that have been alchemically altered to serve other purposes. The new lifeforms are:

Aerogel
Embalming Gel
Taxidermy Gel

162268.name: Animated Skulls
162268.description:
From publisher blurb:

“In a nondescript dwelling, down a dusty hallway, past rooms of unclear purpose, there is a door... a door that looks like many others, except for the ancient maroon tint of the aged wood, and, of course, the glowing runes emblazoned on the stones that make up the door-frame. Should you know its purpose, should you know the correct sequence to touch those runes, you might gain entry to a Storeroom of wonders, shelves and bins and racks beyond counting. Place your torch in the rusty sconce, and enter...”

The Purple Storeroom is a series of tightly-focused supplements that cover topics that do not fit into our larger offerings. They are the pieces that just don’t fit anywhere else or they are the little things we work on to take a break from bigger projects like Purple Mountain, Legendary Treasures, or Lands of Porphyra. They have been stored here for safe keeping.

"I've been waiting such a long time..."

A thin voice out of the dry depths of a tomb... the sarcastic guardian of a cave entrance... an enigmatic, glowing presence floating through dark tunnels...animated skulls have made appearances in fantasy literature and gaming for a long time, varied in purpose and origin, always an intriguing addition to story and adventure!

Purple Duck Storeroom: Animated Skulls includes all the information and tables you need to create and run animated skulls that can be part of your campaign, as tricks, traps, clues, enemies, spies, treasures, or something even more devious.

Come, talk a walk down the dusty halls of the Purple Duck Storeroom-there is something there for everyone!

162269.name: Sniper Elite III
videogamehonor: 2014 Global Game Awards Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
162269.description:
Sniper Elite III is set several years prior to the events of Sniper Elite V2, following the exploits of Office of Strategic Services officer Karl Fairburne as he participates in the North African conflict during World War II, in which he learns of a secret wonder weapon programme by the Nazi forces.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sniper_Elite_III Sniper Elite III]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

162270.name: Napolatronics
162270.description:
Napolatronics is a wargame for 2-4 players, set in a wacky world of smartly uniformed robots launching bold assaults from their rocky, island bases.

This is a complete wargame! All YOU need to add are some dice.

Features of this game include...
1) 4 complete armies of robots! Cavalry, Artilery and Infantry.
2) 4 Battle Mats representing the floating island bases
3) A sheet of Terrain tiles! These randomly drawn tiles will give the gameboard a different layout EVERY game!
4) Easy to follow Rules booklet!
5) Cheatsheets! With these you wont have to reference the rule book at all!

162271.name: Green Lantern Power of the Ring Game
162271.description:
The path is filled with excitement and danger: will you master the four constructs that you need to defeat Parallax? When you arrive at the lantern with the ring, press on the lantern to see the result. An unlit ring means you have to go back on the track. A lit ring means... you've won! Light up the ring and recite the Green Lantern oath!

Players roll a pip die to move around a circular board. Only after collecting all four types of Green Lantern Constructs will a player leave the main board and have an opportunity to win the game. Varying spaces along the way distribute Constructs or force players to discard Constructs, while other spaces allow a player to send themselves or other players to a space of his or her choosing.

Two notable components also affect game play. By landing on a ring space, a player might take the Lantern's ring (an actual light up ring component), allowing him or her to roll the pip die twice and pick from the outcomes. Finally, even after collecting all four Constructs, a player must successfully charge their ring to win. A large Lantern battery piece gives a player a roughly 2/3 chance of victory by spinning a plastic piece, pressing a button, and awaiting the random response.

162273.name: Battlegroup Modern Warfare Rules
162273.description:
Battlegroup has been written because of modern wargamers, dissatisfaction with the commercial rules available. Battlegroup has been
play-tested over the last few years and were used successfully between 1997 and 2008 in the Ultramodern World Wargaming
Championships, the 1997 Royal Air Force Wargames Association Championships and the modern competition at Roll Call 2001-2007.
The feedback from all those experienced players helped the rules evolve into this edition.
Although these rules offer nothing revolutionary in the field of wargames rules you will find Battlegroup faster and easier to follow
than previous modern rules, rules that due to the complexities of modern warfare ended up either too complicated or far too simplistic.
Battlegroup is designed to give the feel of modern combat, taking into account all the latest technologies being fielded, yet still remain
an enjoyable

162274.name: Billy Yank
162274.description:
AMERICAN CIVIL WAR IN 10MM SCALE MINIATURES RULES

The Civil War lasted from 1861 to 1865 and cost the lives of 600,000 Americans; more than in all Americas' other wars combined. Its immediate cause was the decision of several southern states to leave the Union of States. This 'secession' was the result of years of rivalry between north and south and friction between the federal Government and State governments, particularly over the issue of slavery. Some 50,000 books and articles have been written about this epic conflict that re-forged the American nation.
This is a rules system that enables players to re-fight some of the 2,500 battles and skirmishes that made up of this dramatic episode of history. They are based on modern historical research, which dispels

162275.name: Blue Skies, Wood and Canvas
162275.description: These rules are intended for use with 1/144 scale aircraft miniatures. Each aircraft model should be mounted on an hexagon shaped flying stand which has one side designated with an arrow to indicate the direction of forward movement (see Figure 14a) and a collar assembly which allows the insertion and removal of the multi-length altitude dowels.

162276.name: Rouen
162276.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rouen is one of the great cities of medieval France. Situated on the banks of the River Seine – a vital trade route for both European and Scandinavian countries – it is the capital of Normandy. Its population comprises some 25,000 souls, making it one of the largest cities in north-western Europe; and on market days this number swells dramatically. For visitors unaccustomed to the noise, smells and vivacity of metropolitan life, Rouen is an awesome and even terrifying sight.

Of course hidden amongst the swirl of city life, Rouen conceals a number of dark secrets. There are things lurking unseen amongst the innocent citizenry; things that can change their shape or glamour those around them so they may pass for human, occultists that seek to increase their knowledge and swell their ranks. These beings have agendas of their own and, if not stopped, will seek to control and guide this proud city towards their own, nefarious ends.

This sourcebook will take you through the streets of 12th Century Rouen, to the darkest areas of the city where there are few friends for Guardian Priests and far too many enemies.

162278.name: The Sixth Doctor Sourcebook
162278.description:
From publisher blurb:

Celebrating the 50th anniversary year of Doctor Who, this Sourcebook explores the Sixth Doctor’s adventures on Earth and beyond. With detailed information on all the allies, enemies, aliens and gadgets that he encounters, as well as examining each of his adventures, the book contains a wealth of material for the Doctor Who: Adventures in Time and Space RPG, and is also a fact-packed resource for fans of the show!

After sacrificing his life to save Peri in the Caves of Androzani, the Doctor regenerated into his most flamboyant, arrogant and frightening incarnation yet. Save Earth from Halley’s Comet, do battle with the alien mastermind Sil, twice, and face not just the Master – but the Rani too! Return to past adventures, battle terrible foes old and new and face the ultimate trial – the trial of a Time Lord.

It’s time for a change my dear, and not a moment too soon.

162279.name: C3: Command Control and Communications
162279.description:
The aim of these rules is to simulate combat in the period 1789-1815.

COURSE OF A GAME
Each game is assumed to be one of the following formats
a) Competitive - each player has a force which is balanced using a points system. The game commences with the opposing forces (starting on or off table) and advancing towards each other, with intent to give battle and destroy the opposing force. Starting with initial contacts from patrols and/or vanguards prompting their commanders to respond. The main forces are deployed in attempts to seize and/or maintain the initiative. Finally one force is defeated and the victors may attempt pursuit. The rules are primarily designed around this type of game.
b) Scenario – each player has a force defined for the scenario which may be based on fictional or historical events. The objectives and victory conditions being defined by the scenario.

REPRESENTATIVE SCALES
There are variable ground and troop scales to allow for varying sizes of engagements. So in effect the ground scale will vary from 1:2500 (i.e. 1mm on the table = 2.5m in life) to 1:30,000 (1mm = 30m). However in any game the ground and troop scales are directly proportionate to each other.

The game is broken into bounds of varying length. For game purposes these are expressed are periods of minutes. The activity of all troops within any bound is directly related to the time span of the bound. For example a five minute bound allows all troops to complete five minutes of activities. However a 500 minute bound allows all troops five hundred minutes of activities. The reason for the variability is to allow for those periods where little or no activity occurs to be passed over.

Troops are represented by figurines and or models based on varying size bases.

162280.name: Cold Infinity
162280.description:
Cold Infinity is a tabletop ship-to-ship space combat game, focusing on small engagements at the tactical level.The Main Rulebook and the Ship Systems Book (abbreviated SSB) provide all the rules and tables required
to create and play in virtually any space-faring science fiction universe you can imagine.

162281.name: Hark! A Wizard!
162281.description:
From publisher blurb:

You know what I find really tedious? Random NPC wizards and needing to generate a spell list for them, knowing there is better than even odds they will end up dead and looted within 2 rounds of their appearance.

Hark! A Wizard! Is a generator to give NPC wizards a cohesive set of spells in just a few seconds. It is a useful tool for further lowering the prep required with a game of Neoclassical Geek Revival.

162282.name: Destroy All Monsters
162282.description:
Take control of a rampaging monster and destroy other monsters or just crush a city and puny Humans.

To begin playing Destroy All Monsters, you need the following things:

A Gaming Board. Preferably with some kind of urban terrain, but use whatever you have.
2 of 9 Monsters. One per player. These can be of any scale that the players desire, but should be in scale with each other and with the terrain.
Cotton, for representing smoke, ooze, webbing, or other, less mentionable, substances.
A Record Sheet for each Monster. These should be prepared sometime before actual play begins.




Pencils, for recording changes to the above mentioned record sheets.

A Vast Quantity of Six-Sided Dice. You're gonna need 'em.




Something to Represent Power Points. Small tokens of some sort. Beads or Glass Blebs would be ideal. These will be kept in a common pool, and distributed to individual players
as necessary.

Numbered Chits, and Something to mix them in, so that players may determine when it is their turn to move.




To beat all other Monsters present into unconsciousness. And to step on a few humans, while you're at it.

162283.name: Rampaging Monsters
162283.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rampaging Monsters is an adventure toolkit designed for the utterly unprepared GM. When you have no new hooks planned, why not let a monster tear across the countryside? As it trashes a few villages you can rest assured you've bought yourself another week. Designed for use with Neoclassical Geek Revival.

162284.name: Firepower Naval wargaming Rules
162284.description:
Naval gaming with rules and model ships for the period 1900 to 1945 These rules can be used for any of the popular scales, though most players will prefer the smaller scales for space and cost reasons. For
the purpose of this game, scales are divided into two classes; 1/700th and smaller (sub-1/700th). The most popular small scale is 1/3000th. At the end of the rules there is a special section for players (including myself) who prefer the 1/700th - the real scale.

162286.description:
Mars. The very near future.

The Solarus Corporation discovered an infinite source of rare and precious minerals deep in the red crust. Resources that will end the energy crisis on Earth and fuel the deep space expeditions planned as population swells beyond capacity.

You have been chosen to lead an elite crew of Pod pilots who will delve below the surface of Mars in Solarus Corporation's first major drilling expedition. As a part of this maiden voyage, the corporation has agreed to let you reinvest any wealth you uncover back into training your Pod pilots, increasing their skills and efficiencies. Will you be remembered as the greatest Solarus Corporation employee in the galaxy?

Super Motherload is a tile-laying deck-building game, which means that you have your own deck of cards from which you draw each turn. The cards in your deck start out very basic, but over the course of the game you add new and more powerful cards to it. You use these cards to bomb and drill minerals and other bonuses from the game board. You then use the minerals you've collected as money to purchase better cards for your deck. Some cards give you an immediate bonus when you purchase them, and some give you other bonuses when you use them to drill. Each card you purchase from your library is worth victory points (VPs). You can also gain VPs from achievement cards that become available throughout the game. Whoever has the most VPs at the end of the game wins.

Super Motherload features game boards that are added and removed during play to create videogame-like scrolling action, and it challenges spatial relation skills for 2-4 players who love video games, Eurostyle board games, or deck-building card games.
162286.name: Super Motherload
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

Episode 62 - Xia: Legends of a Drift System
Episode 62 -- A New Game That I Didn't Put on the Table

Garrett's Games 500 - Best of 2015 + Contest Resolution!
MOBG 26 Roll for Galaxy 03-03-15
MOBG ep 30 Tabletop Day 2015 21-04-15

Review: Super Motherload

162287.name: Under the Waterless Sea
162287.description:
From publisher blurb:

Under the Waterless Sea' is an adventure and mini-setting set in a small Polynesian city, as well as deep under the ocean, in a seige that is coming to a head one way or another. Players will be able to shift the outcome of the war, and even the future of the entire island chain.

162288.description:
Each night, a secret war is waged. The battlefield is always the same, but the enemy changes; some nights, taking the form of spiders and creepy-crawlies, other nights, taking the form of unknown shapes that shift on the edge of your vision. Your duty is to defend the serenity of dreams from the corruption of the Nightmare by ensuring that the Nightlight stays lit. Take control of a stuffed animal animated by the Child’s imagination and given strength by the magic of dreams themselves!

Rounds are divided into phases, with the players and the Nightmare deck each taking turns to act. First, the stuffed animals raid the Toy Chest for Weapon and Skill cards that they can use to defend against the enemies of the Nightmare. Then, each player is dealt two Nightmare cards, which could either be enemies or Crises, that their stuffed animal must deal with during the next phase. Finally, the dreamscape shifts, and a new Dream card is flipped, adding a new weakness for the Nightmare to exploit.

After each side has prepared, the enemies and stuffed animals take turns attacking. Once every enemy has attacked, each side is granted a short reprieve before starting a new round.

Every round is more dire than the last, but if at least one stuffed animal survives until the end of the third round, the Nightlight has survived until dawn and the players have won the game!

Fight hard, but don’t let the changing nature of dreams distract your stuffed animal and give the Nightmare an opportunity to strike!
162288.name: Nightlight
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 32 - Nightlite
Episode Seventy-Two: Puzzle Pieces!

162289.name: Secrets of Rætikon
162289.description:
Secrets of Rætikon is an action-adventure, open world video game by Broken Rules. The player is a winged creature who explores the environment to find its secrets. Game elements include animals with specific behaviors and ancient puzzles.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secrets_of_R%C3%A6tikon Secrets of Rætikon]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

162290.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Guardians of Deephall
boardgameexpansion: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
162290.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The stronghold of Deephall was once home to a thriving, peaceful community, but now the mountain city lies under constant threat of invasion. A horde of undead, led by dark priests, attacks Deephall constantly. These unending attacks deplete the city's guards and erode the peoples' resolve. Four heroes are all that stands between Deephall and the city's extinction.

Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Guardians of Deephall contains four heroes and three monster groups; these figures were previously available in the first edition of Descent, but are now brought in line with second edition aesthetics through reimagined figure sculpts and artwork. You'll find the orc warrior Mordrog battling in the front lines alongside Lord Hawthorne. At the same time, Sahla, a gifted Healer, focuses his power by channeling the strength of other heroes, even as the deadly assassin known as Silhouette uses her stealth and cunning to cut her enemies down.

The battle for Deephall's fate plays out in two new quests. In "Guardians of Deephall", the heroes must defend the walls of Deephall against a seemingly endless assault of undead and dark priests. Then, in "The Curse of Iona", the hero party must venture into the icy lair of a dragon sorceress to reclaim a pendant that may be Deephall's salvation.

162291.description:
Mech Deck is a light skirmish game in which players draft and build customizable Mechs and deploy them on a modular battlefield. These Mechs are made up of five plastic parts that fit together to form the players piece in the game. Each part of the Mech has unique stats and abilities displayed on their corresponding Mech cards. After taking some damage these parts will be destroyed and the player must remove them from the mini.

Deck cards are drawn each turn giving extra abilities and maneuvers for the players to use. Action cards are played on the player's turn and reaction cards are played on the opponent's turn.
162291.name: Mech Deck
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 001
Vox Republica 076: The Giant PAX East 2015 Recap

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
162292.description:
The Draugr, reanimated dead imbued with magical powers, have come to the region of Trøndelag seeking to corrupt the town of Stjørdal. Only you, a lone revenant hunter, can protect the town and slay they who walk again.

Armed with limited supply of holy water and iron spikes you enter the town square and prepare for the coming onslaught.

The Draugr is a solitaire game playing in about 20 minutes.

To Win:
You must slay 4 of the 6 Draugr. If at anytime during Phase 1 all 7 Townspeople, or more than 7 of the cards (a combination of Townspeople and Locations) are corrupted you lose.

Playing the Game:
The game is played in rounds consisting of two phases: Corruption and Hunt.

Phase 1 - Corruption
Roll the six-sided die once to see which Draugr will hold sway over Stjørdal for the round and will corrupt Locations and Townspeople in the row they are adjacent to, matching the die face to the image on a Draugr Card.

Roll the die a second time and look at the symbol in the upper left corner of the die. Place a Corruption Marker on each card in that Draugr’s row with the matching Corruption Sigil. (See the section on the Shepherdess for protection from this rule.)

If a Townsperson card has been turned over you do not need to place additional Corruption Markers on the card.

Phase 2 - The Hunt
You must now move your player marker up to two adjacent cards in distance (The Nunnery and Foundry are the only two cards to supersede this rule). All movement is orthogonal (horizontally and vertically).

Once you have finished moving you may choose a Special Action of that Townsperson or Location. Some cards have only 1 Special Action, some allow for a choice between 2 Special Actions. You do not have to choose a Special Action if you do not wish to.

If you land on a Townsperson card that has been turned over, no Special Action can be chosen.

If a Special Action allows you to place Holy Water or Iron Markers on a Draugr, take one from your supply on the Town Square card and place it on a Draugr of your choice. If you match the number of markers as indicated in the upper left of the Draugr card, that Draugr is slain and removed from the game. Return all Holy Water and Iron Markers on that Draugr to your supply.

Once a Draugr is slain and their card removed, slide one of the adjacent Draugr cards up or down so that is partially spans either 2 rows (or if 2 Draugr have been slain, 3 rows). The Draugr now holds sway over 10 (or 15) cards for rolls during the Corruption Phase. If you slay all 3 Draugr on one side, no further Draugr are moved to replace those slain.

Game End:
If you are able to slay 4 of the 6 Draugr you are successful and the other Draugr are forced to flee. If at anytime during Phase 1 all the Townspeople, or more than 7 of the cards (a combination of Townspeople and Locations) are corrupted you lose.
162292.name: The Draugr

162293.description: Rail Baron Rivals is a game where you and a rival baron are competing to have the most cash after 12 years of development in the golden age of railroading in the U.S. Northeast. Each year is represented by a turn in which you will roll 5 special dice that are used by one or more railroads to build track, expand cities and improve infrastructure. You may invest in any of these companies by acquiring shares - the more shares you have of the successful railroads the richer you will be. If you can get the right combination of shares and each railroad has increased in value then you have won the game.
162293.name: Rail Baron Rivals

162294.name: The Undercroft (Issue 1 - Jul 2014)
rpgissuearticle: I Want to See My Lawyer!
162294.description:
From the publishers website:

In Heaven Everything is Fine

But not here. Here, everything is awful. If you aren't losing your limbs to obscure diseases you're having them lopped off by solicitors and disgruntled historical figures. Life is hard and short. As a consequence of this unfortunately tight schedule we must strive to pack as much misery into players' lives as possible. Their bodies and minds must be broken or at least so damaged as to wish they had been given a more conclusive result.

It's not easy, oh no, but we're here to help. If you've never had a game where a player has retired their character due mental anguish, outraged at the morals they have so flagrantly tossed away, fondly looking back on a time where they had all their limbs, then The Undercroft is the place to go. We can help. Or maybe more accurately, "help".

In The Undercroft #1 we are showing you an alternative method for inflicting degenerative maladies, donated by the kindly Alex Clements. His take on delayed cruelty and lingering deaths is an inspiration to us all. Further in you will find a favourite of mine: lawyers. Crime has never been quite so fun, I fear it may lead us into a life on the seedy underbelly just for the thrill of being caught and the potential to create a loyal fan-base. Finally we have a little traditional adventure with a less traditional twist.

162295.name: Zik
162295.description: Zik is a party game. Players will have to guess which song is sung by a team mate. But players are not allowed to sing the lyrics, they must use onomatopoeia such as gling-gling, tut, boom etc...

162296.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 4, Issue 18 - Gorganna)
162296.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gorganna

A great new villain for your game, one you will turn to stone over….

162297.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 4, Issue 19 - The Daredevil)
162297.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dare Devil

A great new advanced class for your super games.

162298.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 4, Issue 20 - Powers Consulting)
162298.description:
From publisher blurb:

Powers Consulting

Some heroes need to make a living and those that like the good things in life sign up with Powers Consulting.

162299.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 4, Issue 21 - The Webbed Hand of Crime)
162299.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Webbed Hand of Crime

What do you do when the villains are a bunch a mob like frogs?

162300.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 4, Issue 22 - Etheria)
162300.description:
From publisher blurb:

Etheria

Is she a cult figure or a goddess….

162301.name: Twin Crossings
162301.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mercantile endeavor for four to five 4th level PCs.

Embroiled in a struggle between two rival merchant houses, the party races to assemble and escort a valuable load of cargo to a commerce-starved city.

The loss of the yearly supply ship to a late winter storm places an isolated town in peril. A lone survivor, clinging to a hatch cover and blown hundreds of miles by the tempest, brings the disastrous news. Two premier merchant houses make plans to attempt the overland route. The race is on to get word to the far side of the mountains and assemble a relief caravan to cross back over. The loss of the ship means that any goods that do make it over the hump will yield great profit. The survival of not only of the merchant houses but of the very town itself is dependent on those willing to brave the journey. Monsters, difficult trails, and unscrupulous behavior by the competition stand in the way of success—and profit.

Also included in this adventure:

A flexible encounter sequence that allows the PCs to chart their own course over the mountains.
Rich roleplaying opportunities and skill challenges that impact the party’s final success.
Three new magic items including magical engineering equipment from a hidden cache.
A new monster—the Salt Worm—that leaves naught but the desiccated husks of its victims behind.
Notes on scaling the encounters for parties of six or more.

162302.description:
Montoro is a deduction game where two players compete to get all the goods available. On each turn a player takes the role of "reporting" and his opponent of "manager" where the declarant will announce the number of tricks that will take, and the manager will have to try to thwart the plans of the declarant and make it do more or assets less the number I said. This is a tactical, fast and very pissed game.


Montoro es un juego de deducción donde dos jugadores competirán por conseguir todos los bienes disponibles. En cada turno un jugador toma el rol de “declarante” y su oponente de “gestor”, donde el declarante anunciará el número de bazas que se llevará, y el gestor tendrá que tratar de desbaratar los planes del declarante y hacer que haga más o menos bazas del número que dijo. Se trata de un juego táctico, rápido y con mucha mala leche.
162302.name: Montoro

162303.name: 54 Dragons, Undead & Outsiders (0e/1e)
162303.description:
From publisher blurb:

54 creatures on 54 cards! Plus a cover/checklist card and license info cards. The front of each has amazing art, while the back has 0e/1e stats using the Labyrinth Lord rules. (Easily converts to many other retro-clones.)

Note: The print-it-yourself PDF file is set up to print duplex on a printer. The upper right card front on page one is matches the upper left card back on page two and so on. The corners of each card have lines on the edges to help you trim them down to standard 2.5'x3.5' cards.

162304.name: 54 Dragons, Undead & Outsiders (Generic)
162304.description:
From publisher blurb:

54 creatures on 54 cards! Plus a cover/checklist card and license info cards. The front of each has amazing art, while the back has system neutral information about the creature. (Strengths, weaknesses, allies, tactics, etc.)

These cards are perfect for knowledge checks–if the player rolls well, give them the entire card or just read a few facts if they have an average result. They are also great for GMs as they include information on each creature’s allies and enemies so the GM can better plan an adventure. The cards also remind a GM of the creature’s battle tactics.
